employer_description: Credit Suisse offers you the ideal environment to progress your career, attractive benefits and excellent training. Credit Suisse We are offering a position in the new MiFID/FIDLEG Front Support team in the International Wealth Management division. You will be responsible for the day to day support and advisory tasks for our front offices in the specialist area of MiFID and FIDLEG investor protection. In this role you take over written and telephone support inquiries from the front offices. We are a department which values Diversity and Inclusion (D&I) and is committed to realizing the firm’s D&I ambition which is an integral part of our global cultural values. Qualifications We are looking for: Completed basic banking training, matura or equivalent degree Minimum of 3 years of working experience preferably within Private Banking and an regulatory driven environment, ideally in the field of MiFID/FIDLEG investor protection High sense of responsibility and independent working practice, showing initiative and high level of reliability Distinct solution orientation, service understanding and willingness to perform Good communication skills (written and verbal) Fluency in English and German are a must, any additional language skills would be an advantage Someone who understands the value of diversity in the workplace and is dedicated to fostering an inclusive culture in all aspects of working life so that people from all backgrounds receive equal treatment, realize their full potential and can bring their full, authentic selves to work Ms V. Krause would be delighted to receive your application. We are a leading wealth manager with strong global investment banking capabilities founded in 1856. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, and with more than 45,000 employees from over 150 nations, we are always looking for motivated individuals to help us shape the future for our clients.

The Role: Logitech is a world leader in products that connect people to their digital experiences. With a broad portfolio of interface devices, Logitechs leadership in innovation encompasses a wide variety of corded and cordless peripherals. Logitech is at the forefront of design and is creatively driving a richer experience for digital interactions. Creativity & Productivity (C&P) business group is the biggest division of Logitech, consisting of our mice, keyboards and presentation remotes. It is a key pillar of Logitechs past, present and future as a global brand known for great design and exceptional user experiences. Suggesting and driving product enhancements together with creating a roadmap for new technologies and leading the product / SW portfolio strategy for B2B are only a part of your future Logitech journey. These are the behaviors youll need for success at Logitech. Identify business-building opportunities based on comprehensive customers/users and market understanding Contribute to the overall product & portfolio strategy in line with Logitech strategy and business objectives. Excellent command of English required The right candidate will be curious, insightful and creative, with a strong entrepreneurial mindset and hands-on attitude Flexibility to travel internationally 30% of the time In addition, preferableskills and behaviors include: Strong storytelling and communication skills Be strategic and hands on Be flexible working remotely while creating trust and great internal/external network Education: Graduate in business/ product design/marketing Logitech is the sweet spot for people who are passionate about products, making a mark, and having fun doing it. This role can be located in Lausanne, Cork, Windsor or Newark. The Role: Logitech is a world leader in products that connect people to their digital experiences. The global B2B Senior Product/Portfolio Manager for C&P BG will lead the transformation of the B2B portfolio and product/SW development of C&P categories from the initial business / customer opportunity, product value proposition to the successful market launch. The position calls for a strong business and product marketing experience with a deep B2B industry background. Decide and just Do. Participate in research to find out articulated and unarticulated customer needs Maintain intelligence on competition products performance Lead and/or participate in front-end innovation projects to identify new and valuable opportunities and develop meaningful and relevant product innovations Effectively prioritize and deliver multiple projects in a fast-paced environment Key Qualifications: For consideration, you must bring the following minimum skills and behaviors to our team: Minimum 8 years of demonstrable experience in a product/portfolio management position on B2B market, preferably Consumer Electronics or Software/Services domain Strong interest in consumer electronics and technology business, industry issues and competitors. As a company, were small and flexible enough for every person to take initiative and make things happen.

Die Fresh Food & Beverage-Group (FFB-Group) umfasst die Unternehmungen der Migros Industrie, welche Nahrungsmittel für den täglichen Genuss vom «Zmorge» bis zum «Znacht» anbieten. Rund 4600 Mitarbeitende werden bei der Aproz Sources Minérales SA, der Bischofszell Nahrungsmittel AG, der Hug Bäckerei AG, der JOWA AG und der Sushi Mania SA beschäftigt. Die JOWA AG produziert Brot, Back- und Teigwaren sowie Konditoreiprodukte. Dann erwarten wir gerne Ihre vollständige Bewerbung.

Your team designs and builds the hardware, software and networking technologies that power all of Google's services. Your work has the potential to shape the machinery that goes into our cutting-edge data centers affecting millions of Google users. Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent practical experience. Preferred qualifications: Master's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or a related field. With your technical expertise, you lead projects in multiple areas of expertise (i.e., engineering domains or systems) within a data center facility, including construction and equipment installation/troubleshooting/debugging with vendors. Define the block level design document such as interface protocol, block diagram, transaction flow, pipeline, etc. Perform RTL coding, function/performance simulation debug, Lint/CDC/FV/UPF checks.

employer_description: That’s why Googlers build products that help create opportunities for everyone, whether down the street or across the globe. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you’ll use your technical expertise to lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects from start to finish. You're equally comfortable explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical tradeoffs in product development with engineers.Our goal is to build a Google that looks like the world around us — and we want Googlers to stay and grow when they join us. As part of our efforts to build a Google for everyone, we build diversity, equity, and inclusion into our work and we aim to cultivate a sense of belonging throughout the company. The Google Pixel team focuses on designing and delivering the world's most helpful mobile experience. This includes bringing together the best of Google’s artificial intelligence, software, and hardware to build global smartphones and create transformative experiences for users across the world. Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, Wireless, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience. 1 year of experience in program/project management, working with cross-functional teams. Preferred qualifications: Experience in shipping high volume/quality products and consumer electronics. Knowledge of product life-cycle, tools, processes and operations planning. Excellent team player with creative thinking skills and the ability to partner with technical teams, cross-functional groups, and vendors. You're equally comfortable explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical tradeoffs in product development with engineers.Our goal is to build a Google that looks like the world around us — and we want Googlers to stay and grow when they join us. Partner with the Engineering teams (RF, Desense, Antenna, Carrier). Support device logistics between Wireless teams, Carrier labs, and third-party vendors. Develop, maintain, and communicate key focus points and next steps with engineering, vendors, operations, quality, and management.

Position summary About Deloitte Deloitte is a leading global accounting and consulting company, with approximately 312’000 people in 150 countries and territories. Deloitte is one of the world's leading auditing and advisory firms in the areas of Audit and Risk Advisory, Tax, Consulting and Financial Advisory. Deloitte Consulting is one of the fastest growing business consultancy firms in Switzerland. From strategy development to solution implementation, Deloitte Enterprise Application Finance Technology supports clients to solve complex business challenges by combining process and industry knowledge with deep expertise in enabling technologies and packaged software. Deloitte offers you national and international career opportunities as well as a broad internal and external training programme. What you can expect from us • Our team is growing rapidly and to support this we are seeking talented SAP practitioners to become critical members of Deloitte’s growing SAP practice • As a member of our highly motivated, multicultural team, you can expect new challenges every day. Please submit a complete application, including CV, references and degree certificates, using our online career portal www.deloitte.com/careers. If you have any questions, please contact Bradely Segal at talent@deloitte.ch Deloitte AG and Deloitte Consulting AG are Swiss subsidiaries of Deloitte LLP, the DTTL member firm in the United Kingdom. In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory and Tax & Legal. With more than 2,000 employees at six locations in Basel, Berne, Geneva, Lausanne, Lugano and Zurich, we serve companies and organisations of all legal forms and sizes in all industry sectors. We are international, entrepreneurial and growing fast. Grow your career with us! Deloitte is one of the world's leading auditing and advisory firms in the areas of Audit and Risk Advisory, Tax, Consulting and Financial Advisory. In Switzerland, we have offices in Zurich, Bern, Basel, Geneva, Lausanne and Lugano. Our Consulting team is looking for you! Deloitte Consulting is one of the fastest growing business consultancy firms in Switzerland. Is business consultancy your kind of work? Then we are the right company for you. From strategy development to solution implementation, Deloitte Enterprise Application Finance Technology supports clients to solve complex business challenges by combining process and industry knowledge with deep expertise in enabling technologies and packaged software. Moreover, implementing SAP solutions is what we excel at. We are looking for candidates in Zürich, Basel, and Geneva. You will be responsible for successful delivery of SAP planning solutions based on SAP BPC, SAP BW-IP or SAC to our clients. You should have excellent insights to the functional and technical aspects of SAP Business Planning in the context of SAP ERP and SAP S/4HANA and you have implemented in different project iterations SAP BPC, SAP BW-IP or even planning with SAC. What you can expect from us • Our team is growing rapidly and to support this we are seeking talented SAP practitioners to become critical members of Deloitte’s growing SAP practice • As a member of our highly motivated, multicultural team, you can expect new challenges every day. You will be working on client site, supporting them throughout the whole project life cycle • The chance to prove your self-motivation and creativity on projects with prestigious customers in various industries and in the public sector • We offer you a varied and challenging role in a fast growing company and in hot topics like S/4 HANA • Given our customer base, our projects have a strong international flavour and offer you the chance to be self-motivated and creative Your qualifications • University degree e.g. MSc in Management or Computer Science • Strong knowledge in Group Finance processes (Controlling, Planning and Consolidation) • 3 - 4 years of practical experience in designing and implementing SAP BPC / BW-IP / SAC planning solutions with focus on planning model definition, planning layout design and planning functions • Good understanding of the SAP planning roadmap, especially the integration with S/4 HANA • Very good knowledge of SAP Business Warehouse (BW) in the context of BW embedded or BW on HANA and Analysis for Office tool • Experience in making recommendations for process improvements and transforming business requirements into best practice planning, consolidation and reporting solutions • Strong analytical capabilities and communication skills • Business Proficiency in German • Travel mobility, particularly within Switzerland Any questions? Please submit a complete application, including CV, references and degree certificates, using our online career portal www.deloitte.com/careers. We do not accept applications from recruitment agencies for this position.

Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree in computer science, related field, or equivalent practical experience Cloud certifications for architecture, networking, and/or security (GCP) Experience in Project Management or Program Management in a technical field Experience in cloud computing (e.g., applications, infrastructure, 4G/5G architectures, wireless/wireline infrastructures, and Network cloudification/SDN) Preferred qualifications: MBA Experience in people management Experience working with modern cloud-native paradigms and technologies (Kubernetes, Anthos) Experience with business development, building solutions encompassing data centers and networking Experience in financial and valuation analysis About the job Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. Underneath everything Google users and customers see online or access from the cloud is the network that has been built by the Technology Infrastructure team. Our team focuses on planning and acquiring infrastructure solutions for Google's production network and large Google Cloud customers. Google Cloud provides organizations with leading infrastructure, platform capabilities and industry solutions. We deliver enterprise-grade cloud solutions that leverage Googles cutting-edge technology to help companies operate more efficiently and adapt to changing needs, giving customers a foundation for the future. Customers in more than 150 countries turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems. Responsibilities Operate at a level of leadership for large Google Cloud infrastructure needs in EMEA. Set strategy and objectives for the wider Google Cloud infrastructure planning organization. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree in computer science, related field, or equivalent practical experience Cloud certifications for architecture, networking, and/or security (GCP) Experience in Project Management or Program Management in a technical field Experience in cloud computing (e.g., applications, infrastructure, 4G/5G architectures, wireless/wireline infrastructures, and Network cloudification/SDN) Preferred qualifications: MBA Experience in people management Experience working with modern cloud-native paradigms and technologies (Kubernetes, Anthos) Experience with business development, building solutions encompassing data centers and networking Experience in financial and valuation analysis About the job Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. Our team focuses on planning and acquiring infrastructure solutions for Google's production network and large Google Cloud customers. As a Lead Technical Program Manager, you will travel up to 30% of the time. Google Cloud provides organizations with leading infrastructure, platform capabilities and industry solutions. We deliver enterprise-grade cloud solutions that leverage Googles cutting-edge technology to help companies operate more efficiently and adapt to changing needs, giving customers a foundation for the future. Customers in more than 150 countries turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems. Design solutions with telecoms and fiber, data centers, and telco platform-as-a-service and infrastructure-as-a-service technologies. Work internally and externally planning infrastructure capacities, redundancies, and working with Network Automation/Analytics/Operations, Telco IT, and open source architectures. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

İŞ TANIMI Ofis çalışanlarının Microsoft İşletim Sistemi ve Office uygulamalarında yaşadığı sorunlara müdahale edilmesi, Şirkete ait elektronik donanım ile ilgili tüm süreçlere destek verilmesi, Bilgisayar kullanıcılarının yaşadığı sorunlara müdahale edilmesi, Yardım Masası üzerinden kullanıcı taleplerine yanıt verilmesi. Denetim Hizmetleri Hakkımızda BDO Türkiye, yerli ve yabancı şirketlere denetim, vergi, muhasebe ve danışmanlık alanlarında profesyonel hizmetler sunan bir denetim ve danışmanlık şirketidir. unvanıyla 1981 yılında kurulan şirketimizin tüm ortakları yeminli mali müşavirdir. Kurulduğumuz günden beri amacımız, müşterilerimizin güvenilir danışmanı olarak, yakın ilişkiler içerisinde, ihtiyaçlarına en uygun profesyonel çözümleri sunmaktır. Şirketimiz 1993 yılında, BDO uluslararası denetim ve danışmanlık ağının üyesi olmuştur. BDO global ağının toplam gelirleri 2022 yılında 12.8 milyar ABD Doları olarak gerçekleşmiştir. Das Service Level Management agiert in der Schnittstelle zwischen Kund/innen und dem BIT und sorgt dafür, dass die Servicequalität von Informatikleistungen erfasst und erfüllt wird. Deine Aufgaben    Budgetplanung und Haushaltsvollzug in SAP durchführen; als Ansprechperson für Kunden/innen zum Thema Service Level Management agieren   Technische Kundenanfragen beantworten und Kund/innen beim Planen von Informatikdienstleistungen und Charging unterstützen   Bundesinterne Tools für das Planen von Informatikleistungen und Stammdaten pflegen und administrieren   Bestellungen bewirtschaften; Abklärungen mit in- und externen Kund/innen vornehmen; Reports und Erlöshochrechnungen erstellen   Prozesse durch kontinuierlichen Verbesserungsprozess dokumentieren und aktualisieren; etablierte Kontrollprozesse überprüfen und durchführen          Dein Profil    Bachelor- oder Masterabschluss (kurz bevorstehend oder bei Stellenantritt höchstens ein Jahr zurückliegend) in Betriebswirtschaft oder Wirtschaftsinformatik   Freude an der Analyse und Lösungsfindung für komplexe Themen; vernetztes Denken; Flair für technische Zusammenhänge sowie sehr gute Excel-Kenntnisse   Hohe Sozialkompetenz; selbstverantwortliche und exakte Arbeitsweise; proaktiv und teamorientiert   Leidenschaft für das Thema Kundenzentrierung und Freude am Umsetzen von Kundenbedürfnissen in der täglichen Arbeit   Gute Kenntnisse zweier Amtssprachen        Zusätzliche Informationen   Fachliche Auskünfte erteilt dir gerne:  Frau Marianne Siegenthaler, Leiterin Service Level Management, Tel.

As a Corporate Sales Executive, you'll advocate for Google Cloud Platform as enabling technology for business innovation. You'll introduce Google Cloud Platform to our customers and accounts, drive awareness in the developer and startup community, and leverage and build the Google Cloud Platform partner ecosystem. Google Cloud provides organizations with leading infrastructure, platform capabilities and industry solutions. Customers in more than 150 countries turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems. Responsibilities Engage with prospect organizations to position Google Cloud Platform solutions through strategic value-based proposals, references and analyst data. Work with Google Ads and Google Cloud Account teams to develop and drive pipeline, and provide guidance. Work with Google Cloud Platform partners to develop campaigns. Collaborate with Sales Engineering and Marketing resources to provide input on current collateral materials and ideas on how to improve them to maximize Google Cloud Platform. The Combinatorial Optimization Group is part of the Institute for Operations Research within the Mathematics Department of ETH Zurich. The Combinatorial Optimization Group at ETH Zurich, headed by Prof. Rico Zenklusen, has an opening for a Senior Assistant in Applied Combinatorial Optimization. Job description We are looking for an outstanding candidate with a PhD in Mathematical Optimization or a related field, and strong interests in real-world mathematical optimization challenges, teaching, student supervision, knowledge transfer, and coding/software aspects related to modern applied combinatorial optimization techniques. The position provides exciting opportunities to contribute and shape existing applied projects and spawn new ones, typically in collaboration with industrial partners. We are a well-connected research group with strong international visibility. The position is initially for one year with the possibility of extension for up to a total of three years. The starting date is flexible within 2021. We are renowned for our excellent education, cutting-edge fundamental research and direct transfer of new knowledge into society. We look forward to receiving your online application including the following documents: Cover letter CV List of publications Teaching statement Names and contact information of at least 3 references. Please note that we exclusively accept applications submitted through our online application portal. Late applications may be considered on a case-by-case basis.

Vous travaillerez de plus en collaboration étroite avec les spécialistes internes (Global Payment Services, Electronic Banking, Legal & Compliance, Credit Risk Management, Trade Finance, Forex, Corporate Finance, Leasing, etc.) Vos futurs collègues Nous sommes un team soudé qui aime partager ses connaissances, recherchant avant tout la collaboration tant à l’intérieur de l’équipe, qu’avec les autres divisions de la Banque. Nous basons notre réussite sur cet esprit d’équipe et cette collaboration, éléments absolument essentiels à nos yeux. Vous rejoindrez un Département qui valorise la diversité et l’intégration (D&I) qui fait partie intégrante de nos valeurs culturelles et qui s’engage à atteindre les ambitions de l’Entreprise en la matière.

Seit über 170 Jahren setzt sich die Luzerner Kantonalbank AG (LUKB) für die Bedürfnisse der Bevölkerung und der Wirtschaft im Raum Luzern ein. In dieser vielseitigen, verantwortungsvollen Kaderfunktion erwartet Sie eine Palette aus komplexen Fachthemen und administrativ ausgerichteten Arbeiten. Sie ist und bleibt ein unverzichtbarer Faktor für die wirtschaftliche Entwicklung in ihrem Marktgebiet. Die Markenwerte «führend – persönlich – solide – typisch Lozärn» spiegeln in diesem Kontext die Art und Weise, wie die LUKB und ihre Mitarbeitenden intern zusammenarbeiten und extern wahrgenommen werden wollen. Wir sind beauftragt, Sie für die spannende Drehscheibenfunktion als Sekretär des Verwaltungsrates 60 % (w/m) zu finden. Dazu gehören: Sitzungsvorbereitung mit Traktandenplanung und Dokumentenmanagement, verfassen der Protokolle sowie die Pendenzenführung. Sie optimieren laufend die Prozesse und Abläufe im VR und treiben die Umstellung auf die digitale Arbeitsweise weiter voran. – auch in engem Kontakt mit Behörden – runden Ihren Aufgabenbereich ab. B. im regulatorischen Umfeld oder bei Themen der Nachhaltigkeit und Unternehmensentwicklung. Unterstützt werden Sie von einer Mitarbeiterin des Generalsekretariats, die in einem 50 %-Pensum arbeitet. Wir wenden uns an eine Vertrauenspersönlichkeit mit einer höheren betriebswirtschaftlichen oder juristischen Aus- und Weiterbildung (Uni/FH o. und entsprechender Berufspraxis in einer vergleichbaren Funktion. Sie verfügen über vertiefte Kenntnisse in Fragen von Legal & Compliance und Corporate Governance sowie vernetzte Denkfähigkeit im Finanzmarktumfeld. Sie sind geübt im Umgang mit MS Office und den neuen digitalen Tools. Absolute Diskretion, diplomatisches Geschick und starkes Networking – persönlich und digital – runden Ihre Fähigkeiten ab.

| Das MAXIM Theater istein gemeinnütziger Verein, der mit seinem Engagement an den Schnittstellen von Kultur, Integration, Bildung und Gemeinschaft wirkt. Haben sie Interesse als Vorstandsmitglied die Geschäftsleitung des MAXIM Theaters mit Ihren Kompetenzen im Ressort Mittelbeschaffung / Fundraising zu unterstützen damit unsere kreativen Ideen auch umgesetzt werden können? Wir verstehen uns als eine Institution, in der diese verschiedenen Komponenten vorkommen, ohne sich gegenseitig auszuschliessen. Job Type: Temporary Contract  Primary Location: Toronto, Ontario, Canada  All Available Locations: Toronto; Calgary; Edmonton; Mississauga; Montreal; Ottawa; Vancouver    Our Purpose At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Working with Deloitte enables you to focus on building the capabilities in Workforce Strategies, Talent Acquisition, and Analytics needed to deliver for the future so that they don't get stale in the context of today's ever-evolving business demands. Work you'll do As a Workforce Strategies Manager, you will use your knowledge of workforce analytics, strategy, and program design and experience in the Higher Ed industry to deliver superlative results for our clients by: Leading your team to synthesize, design, and implement future-focused, strategic projects with high visibility and rapid results - focusing on evaluating sources of talent; and rethinking where work gets done, workplace infrastructure and the employee experience Managing all aspects of project delivery, including client relationship management, risk and issue management, and strategic communications Building your reputation within the firm and in the market for the strong Workforce Strategies knowledge and Higher Ed industry credibility you possess Forging strong relationships with both the clients and project teams that will contribute to your growth and development The Workforce Transformation team At Deloitte Consulting LLP, by helping our clients excel in Workforce Strategies, Rewards & Well-Being, Leadership & Succession, and Learning & Development, we empower HR to better support the business and create value. Qualifications Required: Bachelor's degree 8 years of workforce functions & processes experience Travel up to 50% (While up to 50% of travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice.) Preferred: 8 years of consulting experience Demonstrated knowledge of workforce functions & processes within the Higher Ed industry, with experience in one or more of the following areas: Workforce Strategies, Workforce Capabilities, Talent Acquisition, Career Mobility, Diversity, Equity & Inclusion and/or Workforce & Talent Analytics Experience managing staff and leading small to medium sized teams Strong client presence with project management, presentation, and facilitation skills Ability to succeed in team-based or independent environments Well-organized with the ability to handle several projects/clients simultaneously Strong oral and written communication skills Ability to create and manage client relationships and develop business Dedicated work ethic with a commitment to client service excellence

employer_description: See job description for details Credit Suisse is a leading global wealth manager with strong investment banking capabilities. Embodying entrepreneurial spirit, Credit Suisse delivers holistic financial solutions to our clients, including innovative products and specially tailored advice. We are Credit Suisse. We Offer • An interesting and challenging role in Credit Risk Reporting and Analytics, focusing on the development and delivery of credit risk reports for the whole Credit Suisse Group • You will have the chance to take ownership of the reporting business process as well as data structure and data tables of various risk-reporting databases • You will be required to understand and monitor the data flows between relevant risk reporting systems • Develop and modify reports using Qlik Sense or other strategic platforms, in accordance with the relevant change control standards • Writing SQL queries in Oracle / Sybase / Microsoft Access to perform ad-hoc data analyses and tests as well as providing production support to business users of reporting tools • We are open to discuss flexible working hours! Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, we have a global reach with operations in about 50 countries and employ more than 45,000 people from over 150 different nations. Embodying entrepreneurial spirit, Credit Suisse delivers holistic financial solutions to our clients, including innovative products and specially tailored advice. We are Credit Suisse. We Offer • An interesting and challenging role in Credit Risk Reporting and Analytics, focusing on the development and delivery of credit risk reports for the whole Credit Suisse Group • You will have the chance to take ownership of the reporting business process as well as data structure and data tables of various risk-reporting databases • You will be required to understand and monitor the data flows between relevant risk reporting systems • Develop and modify reports using Qlik Sense or other strategic platforms, in accordance with the relevant change control standards • Writing SQL queries in Oracle / Sybase / Microsoft Access to perform ad-hoc data analyses and tests as well as providing production support to business users of reporting tools • We are open to discuss flexible working hours! Financial certifications like FRM or CFA would be an asset • Objective, results-oriented and teammate personality who enjoys collaborating with colleagues in a spirit of true partnership • Experience of report development in a financial institution is desirable but not mandatory • Business proficiency in English is a must • We are looking for a self-starter with a positive personality, committed to ongoing learning, who loves to share knowledge with others *LI-CSJOB* Ms. N. Schneider would be delighted to receive your application. Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer.

Your team designs and builds the hardware, software and networking technologies that power all of Google's services. Your work has the potential to shape the machinery that goes into our cutting-edge data centers affecting millions of Google users. You will collaborate with Product, Test, and Manufacturing Engineering teams to deploy end-to-end manufacturing solutions.Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our team combines the best of Google AI, Software, and Hardware to create radically helpful experiences. Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or equivalent practical experience. Preferred qualifications: Master's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field. Knowledge of Android Architecture, Android boot process, Kernel, Core Board Support Package (BSP), or Android performance. In this role, you will help to integrate System on Chip (SoC) technologies into mobile phones, tablets, and laptops. You will collaborate with Product, Test, and Manufacturing Engineering teams to deploy end-to-end manufacturing solutions.Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our team combines the best of Google AI, Software, and Hardware to create radically helpful experiences. Design and implement test infrastructure for validation and High Volume Manufacturing (HVM). Design and develop test sequencer, data parsers, and data analytic tools. Develop hardware Application Programming Interface (API) drivers for bench/test equipment.

Microsoft Azure Storage is a highly distributed, massively scalable, and ubiquitously accessible cloud storage platform. Within Azure Storage, the Ultra Disk team (https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/announcing-the-general-availability-of-azure-ultra-disk-storage/) provides next-generation block storage platform for the most demanding cloud storage workloads. Microsoft Azure Storage is a highly distributed, massively scalable, and ubiquitously accessible cloud storage platform. Azure storage already runs at Exascale (storing Exabytes of data) and we will scale our designs over the next decade to support Zettascale (storing Zettabytes of data).

Description du poste Für jeden Geschmack ein Erlebnis - mit rund 200 Standorten sind wir eine der grössten Gastronomieanbieter der Schweiz. Mit täglich wechselnden und unterschiedlichsten Gerichten - von gut bürgerlich über vegetarisch oder vegan bis zu Spezialangeboten auf Grill-, Wok-, Pasta- oder Pizzastationen - begeistern wir unsere Gäste immer wieder aufs Neue. Steckbrief Vertrag unbefristet Fachrichtung Gastronomie / Hotellerie Arbeitsort Chur - Raschärenstrasse 35 Stellenantritt per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung Pensum 8 - 20 Std./Woche Aufgaben In der Funktion als Mitarbeiterin / Mitarbeiter Gastronomie sind Sie verantwortlich für die Beratung sowie die Bedienung unserer Gäste am Buffet, die Gästebetreuung an der Kasse sowie die Pflege der Verkaufsbuffets und der Sicherstellung der korrekten Warenpräsentation.

Nestlé Waters, filiale de Nestlé, est le n° 1 mondial des eaux en bouteille. Nous sommes présents dans la plupart des réseaux de distribution avec un portefeuille riche de 51 marques prestigieuses comme notre première marque d'eaux en bouteille Nestlé Pure Life, ou Perrier et San Pellegrino. Vos missions au quotidien : * Gérer les dossiers export et suivre l'acheminement des marchandises dans le respect de la réglementation en vigueur, de la création des bookings maritimes jusqu'à la livraison des conteneurs sur les terminaux d'embarquement (route/ferroviaire) puis jusqu'aux ports de destination (maritime).

Your ability to lead and take a proactive approach in managing partner relationships to balance both Logitech and partner goals will help ensure long-term success of the business. analysis and data on the state of the business to ensure the correct business decisions are made in a timely manner Partner with account and sales organizations to report on and facilitate attainment of quarterly revenue objectives Serve as primary supply chain interface for the account to address performance, manage improvement initiatives, performance inhibitors within their supply chain network and drive execution of Vendor Compliance requirements Proactively facilitate and drive cross-functional engagement to resolve operational issues and improve channel partner experience Manage, analyze, and report metrics and trends to drive with the account and/or internal organizations, actions to optimize supply chain performance you must bring the following minimum skills and behaviors to our team: More than 8 years of supply chain/operations experience of North America eTail/Retail/ Distribution channels Excellent relationship building skills with internal and external partners Strong communication and influencing skills Strong leadership skills including teambuilding and conflict management and resolution Thorough knowledge of forecasting and inventory modeling Excellent understanding of supplier and channel supply chains Strong knowledge and understanding of how to analyze business problems including driving best practices Knowledge of key retail service level metrics such as In-Stock, Fill Rate and Delivery Performance In addition, preferable skills and behaviors include: Project management skills with capability to manage cross functional teams Experience with a Vendor Managed Inventory model/relationship Location: Minneapolis and Arkansas surrounding areas preferred Education: Bachelor’s degree required Logitech is the sweet spot for people who are passionate about products, making a mark, and having fun doing it. The Role: You have a passion to meet the needs of our channel partners. This experienced hands-on supply chain professional will be the Logitech supply chain operations interface with North America e-tailers, retailers and distribution customers. Decide and just Do. In this role you will: Responsible for supply chain processes that support demand planning activities, inventory management and demand fulfillment for all Logitech product categories with major retail and distribution accounts Lead and drive compelling Collaborative Planning, Forecasting and Replenishment (CPFR) conversations. As a company, we’re small and flexible enough for every person to take initiative and make things happen.

Descrizione dell’offerta di lavoro|About the Team|Our claims team comprises claims professionals of different backgrounds, fields and languages, handling losses in the retail markets across all the main lines of business.|We believe that the way in which claims are handled, through the delivery of our Corporate Solutions Claims Commitment, can be a key differentiator and enables us to provide an outstanding service to our customers.|Put simply : we want outstanding claims service to be the reason customers buy insurance from us.|This position is based in Milan and reports to the Head of Claims for France, Iberia and Italy.|About the Role|You would be responsible for the professional handling of direct insurance claims underwritten in both the retail and international wholesale markets.|The claims portfolio consists of a mix of Casualty (Third Party Liability, Employer's Liability, Product Liability, Product Recall) and Property claims.|You will be acting as lead or as a coinsurer, and capable of technical coverage evaluation and exposure analysis and influencing a market to reach the desired outcome.|Our objective is proactive investigation and evaluation, fair resolution, and delivery of exceptional customer service in line with our commitment.|This role would suit someone in the early stages of their insurance career who is looking to take a junior position in an experienced team and to develop as a claim handler in a growing and dynamic book of business.|Your key responsibilities :|Handle claims of low / medium severity within defined authority including, coverage review, fact investigation, loss evaluation, and crafting and executing on an appropriate claim resolution strategy.||Set and maintain appropriate and timely indemnity and expense reserves in accordance with the guidelines| Proactive diary management to drive claims toward a timely resolution Develop and implement appropriate strategy for fair claim resolution, to include settlement negotiation where needed Select, direct and lead external specialists (attorneys where needed as well) and vendors, including working with them to set appropriate resolution strategy, budgets and effectively managing costs Regularly provide meaningful claims insights and input to internal partners, including underwriters, sales and risk engineering, and studies review and analysis relating to claims, emerging risks, legal, regulatory and societal developments and other industry topics Assist underwriting and others with contractual wording and risk assessments associated with policies or risks Keep Claim Management and internal partners aware of loss potential and material claim developments, consistent with the guidelines Provide accurate information and data for Claims reporting.

Coop søger Strategikonsulenter til Commercial Excellence Vil du være en del af en af de mest spændende transformationer i dansk detail lige nu? Så er du måske den rette kandidat til én af vores spændende stillinger i et nyoprettet program i Coop! Commercial Excellence: Commercial Excellence er en nyoprettet afdeling med det formål at sikre Coop et step change i måden at drive de kommercielle arbejdsgange relateret til sortiment, kampagner, priser og forhandlinger – kort sagt, Coops kommercielle nervesystem. Commercial Excellence er prioritet #1 for at levere vores strategi for Fremtidens Coop og har derigennem bred eksponering med projekter på tværs af bl.a. Vores primære opgave er at supportere Coops forretningsenheder, og som strategikonsulent, er den fornemmeste opgave at bidrage med faktabaserede input, strategisk sparring og nytænkning på kommercielle områder for vores interne stakeholdere. Dine arbejdsopgaver vil derfor være alsidige, men kan blandt andet indebære at: Arbejde projektorienteret, hvor arbejdet kan strække sig fra udvikling af Coops Private Label-strategi, til at drive den årlige strategiproces for vores Kategoriafdeling og Kommercielle Kædeorganisationer, til at projektstyre og drive forhandlinger med vores leverandører i samarbejde med kategoriorganisationen. Bidrage aktivt til udviklingen af vores Commercial Excellence-program som helhed og supportere Coops rejse mod løbende forbedringer af processer, arbejdsgange og værktøjer Hvad bringer du med dig? Det får du hos os i Coop Mulighed for at blive en del af en af Danmarks mest bæredygtige og agendasættende virksomheder, som er drevet af stærke værdier og en sund kultur Eksponering overfor en dynamisk retailindustri under udvikling Mulighed for at være med til at skabe retningen for Coops ca. personalerabatordning i Coops butikker, sommerhusudlejning, personaleklubber og indkøbsfordele Dit ansættelsessted vil være Coop Danmark, Roskildevej 65 i Albertslund – men der vil også være mulighed for hjemmearbejde / fleksibilitet (det afgørende er, at du leverer på dine opgaver, ikke hvorfra). Har du spørgsmål til ovenstående, er du meget velkommen til at kontakte Nicolai Horsner på mobil 26784849 eller e-mail nicolai.horsner@coop.dk Og ønsker du at udvikle dig fagligt og personligt, mens du er med til at præge den kommercielle dagsorden? Så er du måske den rette kandidat til én af vores spændende stillinger i et nyoprettet program i Coop! Commercial Excellence er prioritet #1 for at levere vores strategi for Fremtidens Coop og har derigennem bred eksponering med projekter på tværs af bl.a. Kategori, Kæde, Marketing og Butik. Hvad går jobbet ud på? I Commercial Excellence arbejder vi med hjertet af vores forretning. Vores primære opgave er at supportere Coops forretningsenheder, og som strategikonsulent, er den fornemmeste opgave at bidrage med faktabaserede input, strategisk sparring og nytænkning på kommercielle områder for vores interne stakeholdere. Derudover består en del af arbejdet som strategikonsulent i at drive vores større strategiske projekter i samarbejde med andre dele af organisationen og eksterne konsulenter. Dine arbejdsopgaver vil derfor være alsidige, men kan blandt andet indebære at: Arbejde projektorienteret, hvor arbejdet kan strække sig fra udvikling af Coops Private Label-strategi, til at drive den årlige strategiproces for vores Kategoriafdeling og Kommercielle Kædeorganisationer, til at projektstyre og drive forhandlinger med vores leverandører i samarbejde med kategoriorganisationen. Forberede kvantitative analyser til understøttelse af sortimentsudvikling, leverandørforhandlinger og kategorioptimering Drive udvikling af beslutningsoplæg gennem business cases, facilitering af møder og workshops og derfra udarbejde ledelses- og direktionspræsentationer Være ansvarlig for projektstyring fra start til slut, scoping, planlægning, stakeholder management, implementering, projektrapportering, resultatopfølgning, mm. Rollen i Commercial Excellence egner sig til den, som: Har en relevant uddannelse (fx cand.merc., økonomi, HD, etc.) Du vil blive en del af et ambitiøst og engageret team bestående af bl.a. tidligere konsulenter fra top tier konsulenthuse, som vil tage en aktiv del i din udvikling. Vi har fokus på personlig udvikling, prioriterer et stærkt socialt sammenhold og respekterer hinandens fagligheder. Vi har en uformel tone, vi har det sjovt når vi går på arbejde, og vi hjælper hinanden, når tempoet bliver højt. Du vil derudover også have mulighed for at lære af vores eksterne, strategiske samarbejdspartnere og konsulenthuse. Vi håber, at du har lyst til at være en del af en spændende fremtid i en af Danmarks største virksomheder. Vi indkalder til samtaler løbende. Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig.

employer_description: Credit Suisse offers you the ideal environment to progress your career, attractive benefits and excellent training. Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer. Your field of responsibility This is an exciting opportunity to join the Client Experience team in the Digital Banking unit of our Swiss Universal Bank (SUB) division located in Zurich. In this function, you have the chance to create and design experiences for the bank’s main client channels like CSX, Online and Mobile banking, and the internal tools that our front units use in their day-to-day work. The team is highly diverse and motivated and is not only composed of UX Designers and Researchers but also parents, drawers, travellers, film lovers, hobby bakers, fitness enthusiasts, and booklovers. You will work in a client centric way, closely with our Engineering teams and Product owners, in a true collaborative environment that fosters innovation. Your skills and experience To excel in this role you should possess: You have 5+ years of professional UX Design experience and demonstrable superior Mobile and Web UI design skills with a strong portfolio. You have 2+ years of experience leading a small team of creative designers. Preferably you have previously worked in the finance industry. You have a seasoned personality with the ability to lead workshops and manage senior partners from across the bank, and manage their expectations. We are a leading wealth manager with strong global investment banking capabilities founded in 1856. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, and with more than 45,000 employees from over 150 nations, we are always looking for motivated individuals to help us shape the future for our clients. Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to building a culture of inclusion with a deep sense of belonging for all of us. Our bank provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities, as well as those with other needs or beliefs as may be protected under applicable local law.

We’re in need of some talented individuals to join us as a Breakfast Chef on a part time basis at The Bell Hotel & Inn, Woburn. The Benefits · Competitive hourly rate with the chance to earn tips on each shift · The opportunity to develop your career across our very well-known brands, with over 1800 managed pubs, restaurants and hotels across the UK · Up to 33% discount across all our sites for you and your friends and family · An employee advice and guidance service · As one of the industry’s leading apprenticeship providers, we can offer training and development at any stage of your career, whatever step you decide to take So if you’re interested in joining Greene King, and you’d like to be a Line Chef at The Bell Hotel & Inn then apply! We’re in need of some talented individuals to join us as a Breakfast Chef on a part time basis at The Bell Hotel & Inn, Woburn. Greene King is all about delivering an exceptional, unique experience to our customers, with our seasonal, hearty Pub Classic menu. Whilst working in our kitchens, you’ll find no two days will be the same and you’ll be able to develop your skills with a variety of dishes and menus. It’s our people that make us an incredible place to work, everything we do is underpinned by giving our Chefs and Kitchen teams the freedom to be themselves and own their success. If you’re application is successful, someone from the management team will be in touch with you.

employer_description: Burckhardt Compression is the worldwide market leader for reciprocating compressor systems and the only manufacturer and service provider that covers a full range of reciprocating compressor technologies and services. Burckhardt Compression’s leading technology, broad portfolio of compressor components and the full range of services help customers around the world to find the optimized solution for their reciprocating compressor systems. Burckhardt Compression AG | Location: Winterthur | Nicole Veiga | Tel. Its customized compressor systems are used in the upstream oil & gas, gas transport and storage, refinery, chemical, petrochemical and industrial gas sectors. We are recruiting an Instrumentation & Control Engineer In this position you will work worldwide and perform a variety of tasks on our reciprocating compressor systems Your main responsibilities are: Global Field Service activities in the oil & gas sector Commissioning of reciprocating compressors and systems and attend operation of plants Wiring installation checks in a process-industrial environment, perform loop checks Instrumentation and Control upgrades and modifications Installation and implementation of monitoring and measuring equipment and systems System and software function test (MCC, DCS, SIS) including software adaption Function check of all instruments incl. interlocks, alarms and trips, according Cause & Effect list and Control Description For this challenging position we are looking for a whip-smart engineer with practical experience in an industrial environment and completed education in the electrical or automation sector. You preferably hold a bachelor's degree in electrical engineering, automation, or mechatronics. Ideally, you have already worked on rotating equipment. We offer you an exciting and challenging job in an international environment with career advancement opportunities. We are looking forward to receiving your application.

Als Fachspezialist Automatisierung / Intralogistik arbeitest du am Sortiernetz der Zukunft. Du bist das Bindeglied zwischen Fach, Hersteller, Betrieb und der Inbetriebnahme. Dann ist das deine Gelegenheit! Dazu gehört das Verstehen der fachlichen Anforderungen, das Entwerfen und Bewerten von Lösungsvarianten zu deinem Aufgabengebiet. Du unterstützt unsere Kunden vom Fach bei technischen Fragen, der Weiterentwicklung der bestehenden Anlagen und Prozesse sowie bei der Entwicklung neuer Sortierzentren. Als Mitglied unseres Teams engagierst du dich auch organisationsübergreifend für die Weiterentwicklung der Sortierzentren und Anlagentechnik. Du bist offen, kommunikativ und in der Lage deine Ideen und Konzepte erfolgreich zu präsentieren. Dein Arbeitsumfeld ist geprägt von Werten wie kooperativ, ambitioniert, eigenverantwortlich und innovativ, welche in einem Unternehmen mit Du-Kultur, fest verankert sind Viele Möglichkeiten sich intern oder extern weiter zu entwickeln.

Credit Suisse’s Associates assume a high degree of responsibility for both project management and client relationship building through a wide array of activities. Credit Suisse is noted for the diversity of its employees, but seeks candidates with a common set of abilities: Proven academic achievement, specifically in finance and accounting Ability to communicate optimally at all levels and work independently and as part of a team Demonstrated ability to work in a time sensitive environment. Credit Suisse offers you the ideal environment to progress your career, attractive benefits and excellent training. Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer. Credit Suisse complies with applicable federal, state, and local laws, as well as regulatory requirements, regarding considering of employment qualified individuals with criminal histories and prohibiting discrimination in employment in every jurisdiction in which it maintains facilities. All Credit Suisse employees in the USA must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and submit proof of vaccination prior to their start date, except where exempted by applicable law. As an Associate or VP you will work alongside some of the industry’s best and forward-thinking bankers and have exposure to senior people at a diverse set of companies. Our clients span all industries and regions, and through the coverage and deal teams, Associates get the chance to have high visibility, impact and recognition. Associates/VP responsibilities include: Working with senior coverage officers to develop innovative solutions for client companies Building complex models that help companies understand how they are valued by the market Following an industry to learn the key drivers and trends that influence companies’ decisions Helping management teams craft the storyline to position their companies for sale Traveling with clients on road shows and with senior bankers on site visits Building a network of colleagues both inside CS and outside that will strengthen your career throughout your professional life Your future colleagues The Financial Institutions Group covers a variety of sectors including Asset Management/Hedge Funds/Private Equity, Banks & Depository Institutions, Specialty Finance (commercial and consumer finance companies, Mortgage REITs and new financial service opportunities), Insurance, Latin America FIG, and Financial Technology & Brokerages (market exchanges, traditional and e-brokers, bank and payment services and processors). We are a department which values Diversity and Inclusion (D&I) and is committed to realizing the firm’s D&I ambition which is an integral part of our global cultural values. Your skills and experience Interested applicant must have completed an MBA or equivalent graduate degree and have at least one year of Investment Banking experience. Individuals who have completed a third year as an Investment Banking Analyst without getting an MBA are welcome to apply. We are a leading wealth manager with strong global investment banking capabilities founded in 1856. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, and with more than 45,000 employees from over 150 nations, we are always looking for motivated individuals to help us shape the future for our clients. Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to building a culture of inclusion with a deep sense of belonging for all of us. Our bank provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities, as well as those with other needs or beliefs as may be protected under applicable local law. All Credit Suisse employees in the USA must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and submit proof of vaccination prior to their start date, except where exempted by applicable law.

employer_description: Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. The Google Pixel team focuses on designing and delivering the world's most helpful mobile experience. This includes bringing together the best of Google’s software and hardware to build global smartphones and create transformative experiences for users across the world. Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Communications, Electric Engineering, Statistics, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience. Preferred qualifications: 2 years of experience in developing systems or platforms for internal professional users. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day.

employer_description: Receptions- og konferencekoordinator søges til Frederiksdal Sinatur Hotel & Konference Kan du give vores gæster en fortryllende oplevelse med varme smil, når de skal afholde møder midt i naturen ved Mølleåen i Lyngby, og kan du koordinere store og små arrangementer uden at miste overblikket? Så har vi måske jobbet til dig! Du vil også have din gang i vores reception, hvor du vil være husets "hjerte" og den første, som vores gæster møder, når de ankommer til hotellet. Her er din vigtigste opgave at få gæsterne til at føle sig trygge og hjemme. Din evne til at sætte dig ind i vores gæsters behov skal være med til at sikre, at de får lige nøjagtig den ekstra forkælelse, som de har brug for. Vi forventer, at du: Har lyst og ikke mindst evne og vilje til at arbejde i et travlt konference- og hotelmiljø med plads til forskelligheder Har kvalitets- og ordenssans samt øje for detaljen Er i besiddelse af en positiv og nysgerrig indstilling, hvor du tænker i kreative løsninger og muligheder frem for begrænsninger Har salgs- og hotelerfaring gerne fra lignende stilling Har kendskab til et Property Management System - det er ikke et krav, men vil være en fordel At du har en høj arbejdsmoral: Er stabil, fleksibel og tager ansvar At du er flydende i dansk og engelsk Vi tilbyder: Trygge ansættelsesvilkår og fordelagtige personalegoder En fantastisk virksomhedskultur med plads til den enkelte og rig mulighed for udvikling Et hold dygtige og passionerede kolleger, der glæder sig til at få dig med på holdet En atmosfære som er afslappet og uden stramtsiddende slips En 37 timers stilling, hvor aften- og weekendvagter også må forventes. Om os: Frederiksdal er en del af hotelkæden Sinatur Hotel & Konference, der består af i alt seks unikke hoteller med smuk natur som fællesnævner. Alle Sinaturhotellerne har høje ambitioner, når det kommer til at passe på naturen og drive en bæredygtig forretning. Vi har en række ambitiøse mål på naturens vegne, der blandt andet betyder, at vi i udgangen af 2020 er blevet B Corp certificeret . Vi er på en spændende grøn rejse, som kun lige er begyndt, og som du får rig mulighed for at være en del af.
industry: accommodation, hotel, restaurants and food service

CH - Visp Lonza ist heute ein weltweit führendes Unternehmen im Bereich Life Sciences, welches auf drei Kontinenten tätig ist. Wir sind in der Wissenschaft tätig, jedoch gibt es keine Zauberformel dafür, wie wir die Arbeit angehen. Unsere wichtigste wissenschaftliche Lösung sind talentierte Mitarbeitende, die zusammenarbeiten und Ideen entwickeln, die anderen Unternehmen helfen, Menschen zu helfen. Im Gegenzug steuern unsere Mitarbeitenden ihre Karriere selbstständig. Denn ihre Ideen, ob gross und klein, verbessern die Welt. Und das ist die Art von Arbeit, an der wir Teil haben möchten. Als Auftragshersteller im Bereich der Produktion von pharmazeutischen Wirkstoffen suchen wir innerhalb der Abteilung Quality Assurance für den Standort Visp einen QA GMP Audit Manager (m/w/d) zur Betreuung von GMP Audits, die von unsere Kunden am Standort durchgeführt werden. In diese Stelle arbeiten Sie eng mit den Auditoren unsere Kunden zusammen und präsentieren unser Qualitätssystem.

Staefa, Switzerland         Test Engineer          In a professional and international team of test engineers you contribute with your excellent engineering and verification skills to the success of Sonova’s state-of-the-art hearing device solutions. Sonova AG Laubisrütistrasse 28 CH-8712 Stäfa +41 58 928 01 01 Who we are  In a life without sound, our work provides meaning. As a leading provider of innovative hearing care solutions, we are not just a company that makes products: we are a team on a mission to help people enjoy the delight of hearing. To enable a life without limitations, we – through our core business brands Phonak, Unitron, Hansaton, Advanced Bionics and AudioNova – develop, manufacture and distribute solutions that push the limits of technology and redefine the future of our industry. Your tasks     Analyze, design, document, review and execute test cases, report test execution and maintain the existing test base  Defect handling, investigate, report and re-test defects  Support feature development with investigation and explorative testing  Develop concepts for new solutions required for the manual system verification of hearing devices and their interaction with mobile devices, apps and other accessories  Collaborate closely with test managers, test engineers, developers and application experts of various disciplines in an agile development environment      Your profile     Engineering degree, higher technical school or apprenticeship with diploma in computer sciences or related technical discipline  At least 1+ years of professional work experience in testing, preferably in a regulated industry, ISTQB certificate / CAS in SW testing is a plus  Affinity to hardware, mobile devices and wireless communication  Passion for high quality and precise documentation  Flexible, creative, positive thinking and team-player, ability to work effectively across geographical, cultural and language borders  Profound communication skills in English, German is a plus      Our offer    We can offer you a new challenge, with interesting tasks and much more – including an open corporate culture, flat hierarchies, support for further training and development, opportunities to take on responsibility, an excellent range of foods, sports and cultural facilities, attractive employment conditions, and flexible working time models in various roles. Daryl Alther, Talent Acquisition Manager, is looking forward to receiving your complete application (CV, references and certificates) via our online job application platform. For this vacancy only direct applications will be considered.

About the job Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. Google Assistant is a fast-paced organization leading the way in developing conversational interfaces that transform how things get done. The organization has recently shifted towards an Android-first strategy with the roadmap of making Google Assistant a neutral orchestrator of apps and services. Google Assistant's goal is to be a more capable, voice-forward helper for users to get things done reliably across Android and Google hardware. This strategy rests on Google Assistant's ability to motivate and integrate with Android developers. Our team is part of the Google Assistant Integrations Platform and owns the developer experience. Historically our team has delivered tooling and infrastructure for building 3P actions on the Google Assistant stack (for a variety of Google Assistant Devices including Home and Smart Displays). Lead a workstream of engineers to build tools and libraries that help Android developers integrate apps with the Google Assistant. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. Minimum qualifications: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience. 5 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages, and with data structures/algorithms. 3 years of experience testing, maintaining, or launching software products, and 1 year of experience with software design and architecture. Preferred qualifications: Master's degree or PhD in Computer Science or related technical field. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. employer_description: CH - Visp Today Lonza is a global leader in life sciences. Key responsibilities: Manage operational activities for assigned manufacturing projects in cell banking area Act as subject matter expert in manufacturing working in an interdisciplinary team of biotechnologists, scientists, lab technicians and specialists You will be accountable for the performance and results of assigned projects In cell banking you will be in the lead for process transfer, preparation and release of master and working cell banks This responsibility covers all process steps of mammalian cell banking from cell culture to filling including viability studies for clinical and commercial manufacturing projects as well as end of and post production cell banks Key requirements: Master degree or PhD in Biology, Biotechnology, Biochemistry or similar field Good biotechnology expertise in the area of cell banking (cell culture and filling, viability studies) Very good GMP understanding Significant experience in cell banking units Excellent communication skills in English and/or German Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. CH - Visp Today Lonza is a global leader in life sciences. We are more than 15,000 employees in more than 100 locations around the world. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.

Wir leben eine offene Unternehmenskultur, legen Wert auf einen respektvollen Umgang und schätzen Vielfalt.

Den Pionier in uns beleben, wie damals Gottlieb Duttweiler. Eine Karriere bei der Migros Bank bedeutet - auf zum Aufbruch! Deine Anfrage werden wir selbstverständlich vertraulich behandeln. Your team designs and builds the hardware, software and networking technologies that power all of Google's services. Your work has the potential to shape the machinery that goes into our cutting-edge data centers affecting millions of Google users. You'll work cross-functionally with many teams across Google, and drive user experiences.Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our team combines the best of Google AI, Software, and Hardware to create radically helpful experiences. Collaborate with Google Research and Product Management teams to define the product roadmap for audio, ambient compute, and machine learning user experiences on a SoC for a variety of Google devices. Collaborate on the architecture and work streams for user experiences with Google Research, Product Management, SoC Architecture, Audio IP Architecture, SoC Power and Performance, Security, Software App and Driver, and Design and Verification Implementation teams. Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent practical experience. Preferred qualifications: Experience in architecting ambient or always on hardware and workflows for ultra low power mobile/IoT SoC applications. Experience collaborating cross-functionally with Product Management, SoC architecture, IP design and verification, Machine Learning algorithm, and Software Driver teams. Our team combines the best of Google AI, Software, and Hardware to create radically helpful experiences. Collaborate on the architecture and work streams for user experiences with Google Research, Product Management, SoC Architecture, Audio IP Architecture, SoC Power and Performance, Security, Software App and Driver, and Design and Verification Implementation teams.

At Google, we follow a simple but vital premise: "Focus on the user and all else will follow." Google’s Interaction Designers take complex tasks and make them intuitive and easy-to-use for billions of people around the globe. Throughout the design process—from creating user flows and wireframes to building user interface mockups and prototypes—you’ll envision how people will experience our products, and bring that direction to life in a way that feels inspired, refined, and even magical.Google User Experience (UX) is made up of multi-disciplinary teams of UX Designers, Researchers, Writers, Content Strategists, Program Managers, and Engineers: we care deeply about the people who use our products. We collaborate closely with each other and with engineering and product management to create industry-leading products that deliver value for the people who use them, and for Google’s businesses.As an Interaction Designer, you’ll rely on user-centered design methods to craft industry-leading user experiences—from concept to execution. Like all of our UX jobs, you’ll collaborate with your design partners to leverage and evolve the Google design language to build beautiful, innovative, inspired products that people love to use. The Google Pixel team focuses on designing and delivering the world's most helpful mobile experience. This includes bringing together the best of Google’s artificial intelligence, software, and hardware to build global smartphones and create transformative experiences for users across the world. Guide problem solving with teams to develop new solutions, and push and evolve smartphone and smartwatch experiences further and bring Google magic to Pixel. Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Interaction Design, Graphic Design, or equivalent practical experience. 6 years of experience in UX interaction design and visual/graphic design. Experience designing for mobile, tablet, or smart watch products. Preferred qualifications: Experience designing across multiple platforms, including Android, and multiple form factors including phone, tablet, and smartwatches. Radisson Hotel Group er en af verdens største hotelkoncerner med ni karakteristiske hotelbrands og mere end 1.600 hoteller i drift og under udvikling i 120 lande. Vores overordnede brandløfte er Every Moment Matters og Yes I Can! er vores servicefilosofi. Mennesker er kernen i vores forretnings succes nu og i fremtiden. Vores teams er ægte Moment Makers, og sammen skaber vi kulturen, ånden, miljøet og mulighederne, der giver dig grundlaget for at kunne yde dit bedste, hver dag og hver gang. Vi leder nu efter en Account Manager til vores dynamiske salgs-team her i Radisson Hotel Group! Trives du i en kundefokuseret rolle indenfor salg? Så er det måske dig vi søger! Om stillingen som Account Manager Vi søger en Account Manager til det danske marked med base i København. Dette er en tidsbegrænset stilling af ca. 1 års varighed. Vores salgs-team, er præget af en stærk vinder-mentalitet og passion for optimering af salg og vækst. Vi stræber efter at levere oplevelser udover det sædvanlige og sikre mindeværdige øjeblikke for vores gæster. Som Account Manager bliver du en del af et team, der fokuserer på at levere exceptionel service, der har det sjovt mens vi gør det og som tror på, at alt er muligt! Primære ansvarsområder for vores nye Account Manager: Proaktivt identificere og kontakte nye kunder med henblik på salg til vores hoteller i Danmark Generering af leads med fokus på new bizz. Derfor tilbyder vi bl.a. : Du bliver en del af en arbejdsplads, der er kåret som den 4. bedste arbejdsgiver indenfor rejsebranchen globalt, rangeret af Forbes i 2021 og 2022 Særlige priser for vores medarbejdere samt venner og familie, mens de rejser og opholder sig på vores hoteller Vi tager vores motto " We grow talent, talent grows us " alvorligt. Er du klar til at blive en del af en af de største hotelkæder i verden? Der vil løbende blive afholdt samtaler, så vi anbefaler at du ikke venter med at ansøge til sidste dag i perioden. Bliv en del af en verden af Moment Makers - vi glæder os til at lære dig at kende! Yderligere information: Lokation: Denne stilling har base på Radisson Blu Scandinavia Hotel, København Varighed: Dette er en tidsbegrænset stilling af ca. 1 års varighed. Ansøgning: Af hensyn til datasikkerhed modtager vi ikke ansøgninger på mail, men kun gennem vores karriereside.
industry: accommodation, hotel, restaurants and food service
