Accept payment for guests accounts both at the time of registration and at checkout. Accurately handle cash transactions and balance a cash drawer to the given amount. Answer all calls promptly correctly transfer all calls to appropriate departments. Logging of all guest requests and room defects in the appropriate system. Answer inquiries pertaining to hotel policies, services, registration, shopping, dining, entertainment, and travel directions. Assist with handling mail, packages, facsimiles, and guest items. SUPPORTIVE FUNCTIONS In addition to performance of the essential functions, this position may be required to perform a combination of the following supportive functions, with the percentage of time performing each function to be solely determined by the manager based upon the particular requirements of the hotel: Assist with any guest inquiry. PHYSICAL DEMANDS Environmental conditions are inside, a job is considered inside if staff spends approximately 75 percent or more of the time inside. Temperature is moderate and controlled by hotel environmental systems. Vision occurs continuously with the most common visual functions being those of near and color vision and depth perception. Must possess basic computational ability. Self-driven and able to work independently. Experience in a front desk or customer service role preferred. Staff with irregular attendance / tardiness will be subject to disciplinary action, up to and including termination of employment. Upon employment, all staff is required to fully comply with Azul Hospitality rules and regulations for the safe and effective operation of the hotels facilities. Staff members who violate hotel rules and regulations will be subject to disciplinary action, up to and including termination of employment. Due to the cyclical nature of the hospitality industry, staff members may be required to work varying schedules to reflect the business needs of the hotel.
industry: accommodation, hotel, restaurants and food service

employer_description: The developed close-to-metal and low-power DSP platform is used in all Sonova hearing instruments and products. Your tasks Develop (specify, implement, verify, document and maintain) the lowest levels of the embedded software (C) deployed in Sonova hearing aids, with focus on OS-less real-time audio signal processing Manage DSP-related hardware blocks within an application-independent hardware abstraction layer Build Simulink models of audio hardware peripherals and simulation environments (C++, Tcl) supporting model-based development of signal processing applications Contribute to definition and verification (FPGA, custom simulators) of DSP-related hardware blocks for next-generation custom ASICs Engage in the continuous improvement of code quality and development processes Your profile University degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related technical field 3+ years of experience in the area of embedded software, and in C/C++, as well as in signal processing Knowledge of hardware DSP architectures Familiar with ASIC development workflows is a plus Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Fluent in English, German is a plus Our offer We can offer you a new challenge, with interesting tasks and much more including an open corporate culture, flat hierarchies, support for further training and development, opportunities to take on responsibility, an excellent range of foods, sports and cultural facilities, attractive employment conditions, and flexible working time models in various roles. Sonova AG Laubisrtistrasse 28 CH-8712 Stfa +41 58 928 01 01 Who we are In a life without sound, our work provides meaning. As a leading provider of innovative hearing care solutions, we are not just a company that makes products: we are a team on a mission to help people enjoy the delight of hearing. To enable a life without limitations, we through our core business brands Phonak, Unitron, Hansaton, Advanced Bionics and AudioNova develop, manufacture and distribute solutions that push the limits of technology and redefine the future of our industry. The developed close-to-metal and low-power DSP platform is used in all Sonova hearing instruments and products. Your tasks Develop (specify, implement, verify, document and maintain) the lowest levels of the embedded software (C) deployed in Sonova hearing aids, with focus on OS-less real-time audio signal processing Manage DSP-related hardware blocks within an application-independent hardware abstraction layer Build Simulink models of audio hardware peripherals and simulation environments (C++, Tcl) supporting model-based development of signal processing applications Contribute to definition and verification (FPGA, custom simulators) of DSP-related hardware blocks for next-generation custom ASICs Engage in the continuous improvement of code quality and development processes Your profile University degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related technical field 3+ years of experience in the area of embedded software, and in C/C++, as well as in signal processing Knowledge of hardware DSP architectures Familiar with ASIC development workflows is a plus Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Fluent in English, German is a plus Our offer We can offer you a new challenge, with interesting tasks and much more including an open corporate culture, flat hierarchies, support for further training and development, opportunities to take on responsibility, an excellent range of foods, sports and cultural facilities, attractive employment conditions, and flexible working time models in various roles. Gianni Raffi, Senior Talent Acquisition Manager, is looking forward to receiving your complete application (cover letter, CV, references and certificates) via our online job application platform. For this vacancy only direct applications will be considered.

employer_description: Organization :   Grand Hotel des Bains Kempinski St. Moritz Primary Location :   Switzerland-St. Moritz Job Type :   Regular Job Level :   Team Leader/Skilled Professional Schedule :   Full-time Shift :   Day Job Job Posting :   Jun 17, 2021 Unposting Date :   Jul 31, 2021 Job Number: :   210000PY IT Techniker(m/w/d)     Tradition & modern hospitality. We are looking for you to lead our IT department as a dynamic and motivated IT Techniker from this June onwards in a yearly contract! You ensure the technology experience of our guests and team members alike during and inbetween seasons. Key Responsibilities: Supporting by IT and computer related questions Setting up accounts & work stations Ensuring a secure and PCI compliant set up Creating the monthly schedule Preparing monthly reports Leading annual training Executing of orders, inventories and daily reports Desired Skills & Qualifications: Completed apprenticeship and profound work experience in a comparable position Team oriented work attitude Resilience, professional competence and a very high quality awarness Structured and organized way of working Solution oriented work and economic actions Knowledge of networks & network structures Good German and English skills are a prerequisite, basic knowledge of another foreign language is an advantage   What awaits you: Live and work in the Engadine Alps Diverse shaping options Great work atmosphere in a young and dynamic team International career options and development chances Outstanding employee benefits in all Kempinski Hotels among other Staff Houses directly next to the hotel with washing/laundry rooms, a small gym, community room, community kitchens & a staff restaurant 'Kantinella' In-house day care center for employee children Monthly employee activities such as ski, snowboard, cross country skiing or hiking trips as well as Spa nights and German courses Internal 'Feel Good Committee' to shape the Welfare topics   About Kempinski At Kempinski Hotels we pride ourselves on delivering a beautiful performance for each and every one of our guests. Dedicated to please, educated to entertain and never compromising on the European elegance of service, we are driven by our passion for crafting distinct and meaningful experiences. Each of our remarkable properties is a stage upon which our people perform their best and every day is an opportunity to apply their unique talents. Connected by our shared values, our passion for craftsmanship, and our care for one another, we are a global community of hoteliers.

Vendedor/a y Reposición de mercancía Autoservicio IKEA Gran Via Hospitalet (Indefinido 20h, tarde) "You care about making a positive impact in the world. A job at IKEA is so much more than home furnishings. Perfil del candidato/a (título) Por qué nos vas a encantar Perfil del candidato/a (texto) - Idioma por defecto En IKEA consideramos que todas las personas tienen un talento que ofrecer. Visión y misión del equipo (título) Nuestro equipo en Ikea Visión y misión del equipo (título) Desde IKEA tenemos el compromiso de hacer un mejor día a día para la mayoría de las personas. Todos los colaboradores/as de IKEA disfrutan de un amplio paquete de beneficios que están a tu disposición desde el primer día, aquí te contamos alguno de ellos: Ofrecemos un salario competitivo distribuido en 12 pagas anuales más 2 pagas extras en los meses de julio y diciembre, con un amplio abanico de horarios en jornada continua con los descansos que establece la ley, respetando tú tiempo libre fuera de IKEA. Para que disfrutes al máximo de tus descansos, en nuestro comedor de empleados puedes encontrar gran variedad de productos a precios muy económicos, subvencionados en 2/3 por IKEA. Porque la confianza de trabajar en un lugar seguro es la base para nuestro crecimiento personal y profesional, en IKEA contamos con un servicio médico a tu disposición para cualquier consulta. Porque formas parte de la gran familia IKEA queremos compartir contigo los momentos importantes, por ello celebramos aniversarios, fiestas, Teams Buildings, la llegada del verano, regalo de Navidad. Somos IKEA. IKEA está comprometida con la igualdad de oportunidades y la no discriminación. Location L'Hospitalet de Llobregat Employment type Indefinido Department Ventas y Comercial Deadline 2023-03-21 You already applied for this job. Buscamos personas que empaticen con los clientes, compartan nuestros valores y estén dispuestos a probar nuevos retos. - Eres capaz de tomar iniciativas personales y tienes una excelente atención al cliente con el objetivo de garantizar su satisfacción. - Motivación por la atención al cliente y la gestión logística. Principales responsabilidades (título) Qué harás día a día Principales responsabilidades (texto) - Idioma por defecto Tu misión como vendedor/a de autoservicio consiste en identificar los distintos tipos de clientes según su necesidad de compra y ofrecerles una experiencia de compra divertida, cómoda y satisfactoria para incrementar las ventas. Asesorar sobre los productos, su funcionalidad y sus características, además de dar a conocer a los clientes todos los servicios que facilitan la compra. Reponer la mercancía en la ubicación de los pasillos. Visión y misión del equipo (título) Nuestro equipo en Ikea Visión y misión del equipo (título) Desde IKEA tenemos el compromiso de hacer un mejor día a día para la mayoría de las personas. Porque formas parte de la gran familia IKEA queremos compartir contigo los momentos importantes, por ello celebramos aniversarios, fiestas, Teams Buildings, la llegada del verano, regalo de Navidad. Muchos más te están esperando, ¡descúbrelos! Nuestra oferta gira en torno a productos de decoración que respetan el planeta y llegan a millones de clientes. Y nuestro negocio es posible gracias a unos magníficos colaboradores que reflejan la diversidad humana en todas sus dimensiones y la pasión por la vida en el hogar. Todos aportamos nuestras propias singularidades para crecer y mejorar juntos. Nuestro objetivo de «crear un mundo mejor para la mayoría de las personas» nos sirve de inspiración y nos guía en todo lo que hacemos. Somos IKEA. IKEA está comprometida con la igualdad de oportunidades y la no discriminación.

10 hours ago Full Job Description This job posting is for a position in a restaurant that is independently owned and operated by a franchisee. This means your application will be reviewed by the franchisee who will make any hiring decisions. If hired, the franchisee will be your employer and is alone responsible for any employment related matters. At KFC, we feed the world. We fulfill their life. Our meals matter, and when we serve them with southern hospitality, we make our customer’s day. So our jobs are more than a paycheck – they’re about being independent, having fun, and making new friends. We have a GREAT culture and look for GREAT people to add to our family. You love the excitement of the restaurant business and know every day is different.
industry: accommodation, hotel, restaurants and food service

employer_description: SIX ist eine Arbeitgeberin mit Chancengleichheit. Das sind deine Aufgaben Selbstständige Entwicklung von SIX-übergreifenden Security-Architekturen (Enterprise Architecture) und Security Standards unter Einbezug aller relevanten Aspekte und Stakeholder Mitarbeit bei der Erweiterung des Enterprise Architecture Repositorien (konzeptionell aber auch gerne technische und inhaltliche Umsetzungen) Zusammenarbeit mit Business-, Applikations-, Domänen- und Technischen-Architekten, sowie Mitarbeitern aller IT-Disziplinen und Führungsstufen Inhaltliche/Architektonische Führung bei komplexen strategischen Projekten mit grosser thematischer Bandbreite, Analysen und "out of the box" Denken Aufbereiten von Entscheidungsgrundlagen wie Security Roadmaps, technische Konzepte, komplexe Architekturen sowie die Ableitung der entsprechenden, pragmatischen Handlungsalternativen inklusive der entsprechenden Stakeholder-gerechten Kommunikation Das bringst du mit Master in Informatik oder Wirtschaftsinformatik, sowie umfangreiche Erfahrung im Bereich IT in breit gefächerten Teilgebieten und Rollen und sehr gute Kenntnisse mit Security Standards und ihrer technischen Umsetzung. SIX ist eine Arbeitgeberin mit Chancengleichheit. Wir gestalten schon heute die Zukunft der Finanzmärkte. Deshalb investieren wir in kluge Köpfe, in ihre Ideen, ihr Wissen und ihre Entwicklung. Dafür kombinieren wir unsere besten Seiten. Als Mitarbeiter der Einheit "Enterprise Architecture" (CIT-R) wirst du innerhalb eines kleinen dynamischen Teams konzernweite IT-Sicherheit gestalten. Das sind deine Aufgaben Selbstständige Entwicklung von SIX-übergreifenden Security-Architekturen (Enterprise Architecture) und Security Standards unter Einbezug aller relevanten Aspekte und Stakeholder Mitarbeit bei der Erweiterung des Enterprise Architecture Repositorien (konzeptionell aber auch gerne technische und inhaltliche Umsetzungen) Zusammenarbeit mit Business-, Applikations-, Domänen- und Technischen-Architekten, sowie Mitarbeitern aller IT-Disziplinen und Führungsstufen Inhaltliche/Architektonische Führung bei komplexen strategischen Projekten mit grosser thematischer Bandbreite, Analysen und "out of the box" Denken Aufbereiten von Entscheidungsgrundlagen wie Security Roadmaps, technische Konzepte, komplexe Architekturen sowie die Ableitung der entsprechenden, pragmatischen Handlungsalternativen inklusive der entsprechenden Stakeholder-gerechten Kommunikation Das bringst du mit Master in Informatik oder Wirtschaftsinformatik, sowie umfangreiche Erfahrung im Bereich IT in breit gefächerten Teilgebieten und Rollen und sehr gute Kenntnisse mit Security Standards und ihrer technischen Umsetzung. Idealerweise Erfahrung in verschiedenen Architektur-Methoden und -Werkzeugen (TOGAF, Archimate, SPARX EA, Archi, Planview Enterprise One u.ä.)

employer_description: That's the number of associates in the Novartis Institutes for BioMedical Research (NIBR). Dann sei ein Sales Advisor & mehr bei H&M! Über uns H&M bietet dir ein sich schnell entwickelndes Arbeitsumfeld, in dem du mit Kunden und Kollegen interagierst. Warum H&M? Wenn du einen Job bei H&M antrittst, startest du mit einem Onboarding-Plan, damit du in deiner neuen Rolle Erfolg hast. Ausserdem wirst du während deiner gesamten Karriere bei H&M Unterstützung in deiner beruflichen und persönlichen Entwicklung erhalten. Dienstjahr Dienstaltersprämie nach 10 Dienstjahren HIP-Programm (H&M-Dienstaltersbonus-Programm) Kostenlose externe Beratung durch Movis bei persönlichen und privaten Problemen Die H&M-Gruppe behält sich das Recht vor, einen oder mehrere dieser Vorteile ohne Vorankündigung zu ändern oder einzustellen. Bei H&M ist jeder Tag anders, aber hier kannst du sehen, wie ein solcher Tag aussehen kann: Sicherstellung eines hervorragenden Kundenservice auf der Verkaufsfläche, in den Kabinen und an der Kasse Ankurbelung des Umsatzes durch hervorragende Kenntnisse unseres Sortiments und unserer technischen Tools, mit denen du unsere Kunden beim Einkaufen im Store und im Onlineshop unterstützt Aufrechterhaltung einer guten Teamarbeit und aktive Unterstützung deiner Kollegen Sicherstellung einer attraktiven Warenpräsentation und einer nachhaltigen Warenpflege sowie Annahme und Verarbeitung unserer Lieferungen Befolgung unserer Store-Routinen und Richtlinien zur Unterstützung der Schadensprävention und Sicherheit und zur Sicherstellung eines attraktiven Stores Umsetzung der Kassen-Routinen und -Transaktionen, Verkaufskampagnen, Reduktionen und Preisänderungen sowie Anbringung von Sicherheitsetiketten an den Artikeln Qualifikationen Du bist kunden- und dienstleistungsorientiert und hast Spass am Verkaufen. Zusätzliche Informationen #LI-DNI H&M Liebst du die Arbeit im Team? Dann sei ein Sales Advisor & mehr bei H&M! Über uns H&M bietet dir ein sich schnell entwickelndes Arbeitsumfeld, in dem du mit Kunden und Kollegen interagierst. Du gibst jedem die Möglichkeit, gut auszusehen und sich gut zu fühlen. Wir bieten dir einen Arbeitsplatz, an dem jeder Tag ein Abenteuer ist, wo nur du die Grenzen für deine Karrieremöglichkeiten setzt und wo dein persönliches Wachstum und deine persönliche Entwicklung genauso wichtig sind wie unser Geschäft. Warum H&M? Wenn du einen Job bei H&M antrittst, startest du mit einem Onboarding-Plan, damit du in deiner neuen Rolle Erfolg hast. Unsere Feedback-Kultur und verschiedene interne Trainings unterstützen deinen Wachstum je nach deiner Rolle und deinen Entwicklungsbedürfnissen. Du bist offen, kommunikativ und ein ehrgeiziger, tatkräftiger und optimistischer Teamplayer. Dann packe jetzt die Chance auf eine Karriere mit unbegrenzten Möglichkeiten!

employer_description: ‘Deloitte Consulting’ is the answer. As a Manager at Deloitte Consulting, you will be responsible for delivering multiple complex business end-to-end solutions. About the job At Google, we put our users first. You can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development at Google speed. One of the many reasons Google consistently brings innovative, world-changing products to market is because of the collaborative work we do in Product Management. The Platform Foundations team lives within the Google Cloud product area. Google aims to build products that organize the world's information and make it universally accessible to our users. As a Product Manager at Google, you could be working on new technologies, platforms, consumer facing products, and/or enterprise systems. Responsibilities Be responsible for driving the Google Workspace business insights and reporting plan. Define the plan, strategy, and roadmap for the Google Workspace business insights and reporting area as a whole. Execute customer-facing features and solve real customer pain points to deliver business impact for Google Cloud. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. Minimum qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in a technical field or equivalent practical experience. About the job At Google, we put our users first. The world is always changing so we need Product Managers who are continuously adapting and excited to work on products that affect millions of people every day. In this role, you will work cross-functionally to guide products from conception to launch by connecting the technical and business worlds. You can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development at Google speed. One of the many reasons Google consistently brings innovative, world-changing products to market is because of the collaborative work we do in Product Management. Our team works closely with creative and prolific engineers, designers, marketers, etc. We're responsible for guiding products throughout the execution cycle, focusing specifically on analyzing, positioning, packaging, promoting, and tailoring our solutions to our users. The Platform Foundations team lives within the Google Cloud product area. Our mission is to provide seamless adoption and management of Workspace for customers of all sizes, on a trusted, reliable, and scalable platform. As a Product Manager at Google, you could be working on new technologies, platforms, consumer facing products, and/or enterprise systems. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

employer_description: Credit Suisse offers you the ideal environment to progress your career, attractive benefits and excellent training. Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer. Your field of responsibility We offer you an exciting opportunity as the Assistant to the COO of the International Finance Group (IFG) within the International Wealth Management Division, based at our head office in Zur-ich. This role will offer you: The chance to provide full administrative and organizational support for extensive diary man-agement including preparation and coordination of internal and external meetings and video conferences The opportunity to bring in your outstanding organizational skills and proactive ideas by support-ing many of the day-to-day activities in the department and preparing leadership meetings, workshops and events The accountability to ensure diligent handling of monitoring and controlling tasks around ex-penses, systems access, working hours and supervisory controls A unique platform with high level of exposure to senior management of the Division, where you are involved in the day-to-day business of a very multifaceted and cheerful environment Your future colleagues We are a department which values Diversity and Inclusion (D&I) and is committed to realizing the firm’s D&I ambition which is an integral part of our global cultural values. We are a leading wealth manager with strong global investment banking capabilities founded in 1856. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, and with more than 45,000 employees from over 150 nations, we are always looking for motivated individuals to help us shape the future for our clients. Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to building a culture of inclusion with a deep sense of belonging for all of us. Our bank provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities, as well as those with other needs or beliefs as may be protected under applicable local law.

Role Summary The St. Louis Pilot Plant technician will be part of a diverse team of scientists and engineers focused on scale up and optimization of mammalian and microbial fermentation/purification processes to enable the efficient production of toxicology and process development supplies in support of Pfizers Biotherapeutics portfolio. Other Job Details: Last Day to Apply: October 1, 2020 Eligible for Employee Referral Bonus: Yes #LI-PFE Sunshine Act Pfizer reports payments and other transfers of value to health care providers as required by federal and state transparency laws and implementing regulations. These laws and regulations require Pfizer to provide government agencies with information such as a health care providers name, address and the type of payments or other value received, generally for public disclosure. Subject to further legal review and statutory or regulatory clarification, which Pfizer intends to pursue, reimbursement of recruiting expenses for licensed physicians may constitute a reportable transfer of value under the federal transparency law commonly known as the Sunshine Act. Therefore, if you are a licensed physician who incurs recruiting expenses as a result of interviewing with Pfizer that we pay or reimburse, your name, address and the amount of payments made currently will be reported to the government. EEO & Employment Eligibility Pfizer is committed to equal opportunity in the terms and conditions of employment for all employees and job applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, disability or veteran status. Pfizer also complies with all applicable national, state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements of the Immigration and Nationality Act and IRCA. Pfizer is an E-Verify employer. Role Responsibilities Duties and responsibilities will include set up, execution and evaluation of non-GMP unit operations such as seed train, bioreactors, centrifugation, filtration, chromatography, UF/DF, conjugation and lyophilization. Basic Qualifications HS diploma, Associates Degree, or BS/BA in Biotechnology, Microbiology, Cell Biology, Chemical Engineering, Biochemistry or equivalent. 5+ years of experience in a laboratory or manufacturing environment (bioprocess or chemical process industry). Preferred Qualifications Prior experience in a Biological Pilot Plant or Commercial Manufacturing setting is highly desired. This position is normally a 1st Shift (7:30 am to 4:00 pm) position and will require overtime coverage for occasional weekend operations and sampling. While on 3rd Shift the technician will earn a 15% shift differential. Therefore, if you are a licensed physician who incurs recruiting expenses as a result of interviewing with Pfizer that we pay or reimburse, your name, address and the amount of payments made currently will be reported to the government. employer_description: Staefa, Switzerland Supply Chain & Production Planner In this function you are part of the „Site Supply“ team of the Sonova Operation Center Stäfa. Sonova AG Laubisrütistrasse 28 CH-8712 Stäfa +41 58 928 01 01 Who we are In a life without sound, our work provides meaning. As a leading provider of innovative hearing care solutions, we are not just a company that makes products: we are a team on a mission to help people enjoy the delight of hearing. To enable a life without limitations, we – through our core business brands Phonak, Unitron, Hansaton, Advanced Bionics and AudioNova – develop, manufacture and distribute solutions that push the limits of technology and redefine the future of our industry. Staefa, Switzerland Supply Chain & Production Planner In this function you are part of the „Site Supply“ team of the Sonova Operation Center Stäfa. Our team is responsible for production planning in Stäfa and with the international production network. In this versatile position you are working at the interface between logistics, procurement as well as engineering and production. Daryl Alther, Manager Talent Acquisition, is looking forward to receiving your complete application (CV, references and certificates) via our online job application platform. For this vacancy only direct applications will be considered.

4.2 Full-time3 hours ago Full Job Description Overview We are seeking the next leader to join the Integrated Marketing Campaign Team at Microsoft Store! You will manage the marketing strategy for our first party product launch campaigns at Microsoft Store (including Xbox, Surface, Windows, Office/M365). In this role, you will be part of a fast-paced dynamic team which partners across multiple stakeholders within Microsoft to bring products to market to consumers and small businesses. As a part of our broader Microsoft Store Marketing team, you would be accountable for helping us to lead best-in-class campaign experiences across the organization and integrated marketing channels. Establish relationships across Microsoft (creative teams, channel marketing, brand, 3rd party retail, web, etc.) Responsibilities Responsibilities Create customer-first, connective tissue, throughout launches that makes Microsoft Store the best place to experience and purchase Microsoft products. Drive cross-team alignment with multiple channel partners and Microsoft teams to develop campaign go-to-market strategy that will come to life across all channels Manage a contract employee who will serve as your direct report; responsible for assisting and scaling support across product launch campaigns Maintain scrupulous security protocols, including the supervision of contingent staff asset manager for distribution of highly confidential marketing assets. Develop and socialize strategic briefs that are informed by Microsoft business and marketing objectives, competitive landscape, and customer insights and segmentation. Develop communications to inform wider Microsoft and senior leadership teams of campaign approach, creative, and marketing plans Facilitate campaign updates and discussions in large groups, informing teams of critical upcoming milestones and campaign tracking Work closely with measurement teams to gather, analyze, and summarize campaign reports that will impact future workstreams Qualifications Minimum qualifications 3-5 years of experience in digital marketing, campaign GTM strategy, or integrated marketing Excellent project management ability Strong formal and colloquial communications skills Agency and vendor management. Highly preferred experience and skills Digital marketing in retail or ecommerce Demonstrated ability to deliver strategy in digital marketing landscape Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in communications, business, or marketing Ability to rapidly gain/build trust and confidence of stakeholders Big picture problem solving - thrives in ambiguity and has keen ability to identify gaps/overlaps across teams/orgs and projects Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work. This team is responsible for bringing together our customer engagement channels and helping to drive our integrated marketing approach. You will manage the marketing strategy for our first party product launch campaigns at Microsoft Store (including Xbox, Surface, Windows, Office/M365). If you are a digital marketing guru, love to collaborate and have experience driving integrated campaigns within a highly matrixed organization, we encourage you to apply. What our team offers At the core, we are a customer-focused team that encourages a diverse & inclusive culture. We are respectful, collaborative, accountable and approach work with a fun, positive attitude. Support who you are as your authentic self. Establish relationships across Microsoft (creative teams, channel marketing, brand, 3rd party retail, web, etc.) Drive cross-team alignment with multiple channel partners and Microsoft teams to develop campaign go-to-market strategy that will come to life across all channels Manage a contract employee who will serve as your direct report; responsible for assisting and scaling support across product launch campaigns Maintain scrupulous security protocols, including the supervision of contingent staff asset manager for distribution of highly confidential marketing assets. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

Develop and maintain the applications with an end-to-end perspective CI/CD pipelines with all the fancy DevOps tools are where you feel right at home Support other teams with infrastructure, pipeline and performance issues Job-sharing is possible What you do is who we are.

With over 15,000 employees worldwide, the Microsoft Customer Experience and Success (CEnS) organization is responsible for the strategy, design, and implementation of the Microsoft end-to-end customer experience. This newly expanded organization reflects the Microsoft ambition to be known as a customer experience company, ensuring our Microsoft mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more is enabled by delighting customers and consistently exceeding their expectations in every interaction through a connected customer experience. Microsoft has a tremendous opportunity to exceed customer expectations and drive greater customer loyalty and trust, which leads to greater satisfaction, retention, and growth. You will be responsible for ensuring our teams provide a positive support experience, which includes being responsive to our customers and effectively partnering with stakeholders on the most critical problems for Microsoft customers. You will represent Microsoft to our customers and will work directly with our most relevant internal groups to drive change that enhances the customer experience. You will act as the voice of the customer to internal audiences such as the Microsoft Engineering Group, leveraging the culture of customer obsession at Microsoft to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. The CEnS organization is looking for people with a passion for delivering customer success to help us build a future where customers come to us, not only because we provide industry-leading products and services, and also because we provide a differentiated and connected customer experience that is rooted in our commitment to delivering on customer outcomes. We are looking for an intellectually curious, customer-obsessed Support Engineering Manager, who has a demonstrated track record in building teams through effective and strong leadership and has empowered people to help customers succeed. You will represent Microsoft to our customers and will work directly with our most relevant internal groups to drive change that enhances the customer experience. Location: May be flexible within Canada for the right candidate

Today Lonza is a global leader in life sciences. Key Responsibilities Ensure that internal/ external GMP standards and regulatory requirements related to process validations are adhered to in projects Participate in or moderate cross-functional Risk Assessments to define the scope of validation/ study activities Assess validation data for conformance to protocol acceptance criteria and support the investigation and evaluation of deviations from the plans as well as the definition of associated corrective measures Issue, review or approve Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and project related documents Be involved as Subject Matter Expert in the execution of Discrepancy Records and Change Requests Represent the Quality Unit in cross-functional teams Assist the department in developing programs and SOPs to meet current industry standards, internal and external regulatory requirements Act as author of parts of Annual Product Quality Reviews Participate and support regulatory inspections and customer audits Supports cGMP training programs and train/ mentor junior Lonza employees to better accomplish and perform in their duties as quality professionals Key Requirements Bachelor, Master degree or PhD in Chemistry, Biotechnology, Life Sciences or related field Significant experience in the GMP regulated pharmaceutical industry; preferable in a role within the Quality Unit Strong background in cGMP Broad knowledge in biotechnological manufacturing processes, validation approaches and risk management Sound experience in representing Quality and Compliance in projects Good communication skills and experience in interaction with all kind of interfaces within the organization and with regulatory agencies (Swissmedic, FDA etc.) Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communications skills Excellent organizational skills Strong team orientation and solution- oriented way of working Fluency in English, German would be an advantage People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. Today Lonza is a global leader in life sciences. We are more than 15,000 employees in more than 100 locations around the world. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of. For , our recently launched unique biological manufacturing and development concept in , we have multiple openings. Become part of this exciting opportunity and join our team by applying for a position as QA Process Validation Manager. In addition, you will act as key member in cross-functional technical project teams and support the site as subject matter expert during inspections by authorities or customer audits. The position is based in Visp, the site is easily commutable from the Bernese Oberland (40 minutes by train from Thun). Key Responsibilities Ensure that internal/ external GMP standards and regulatory requirements related to process validations are adhered to in projects Participate in or moderate cross-functional Risk Assessments to define the scope of validation/ study activities Assess validation data for conformance to protocol acceptance criteria and support the investigation and evaluation of deviations from the plans as well as the definition of associated corrective measures Issue, review or approve Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and project related documents Be involved as Subject Matter Expert in the execution of Discrepancy Records and Change Requests Represent the Quality Unit in cross-functional teams Assist the department in developing programs and SOPs to meet current industry standards, internal and external regulatory requirements Act as author of parts of Annual Product Quality Reviews Participate and support regulatory inspections and customer audits Supports cGMP training programs and train/ mentor junior Lonza employees to better accomplish and perform in their duties as quality professionals Key Requirements Bachelor, Master degree or PhD in Chemistry, Biotechnology, Life Sciences or related field Significant experience in the GMP regulated pharmaceutical industry; preferable in a role within the Quality Unit Strong background in cGMP Broad knowledge in biotechnological manufacturing processes, validation approaches and risk management Sound experience in representing Quality and Compliance in projects Good communication skills and experience in interaction with all kind of interfaces within the organization and with regulatory agencies (Swissmedic, FDA etc.)

About Swiss Re Swiss Re is one of the world’s leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. At Swiss Re we combine experience with creative thinking and cutting-edge expertise to create new opportunities and solutions for our clients. We execute on a business directive to grow Swiss Re's competitive edge in natural perils (re)insurance in close collaboration with underwriters and clients. About the team The catastrophe perils department is responsible for Swiss Re’s global natural catastrophe risk assessment and related client services. The department advances state of the art probabilistic and proprietary modelling technology for earthquakes, windstorm and flood hazards, with a clear business directive and in close collaboration with Swiss Re’s underwriters and clients. Swiss Re offers modern work models and attractive workplaces that allow all employees to adapt to changing work preferences and life phases. We offer a flexible working environment where curious and adaptable people thrive. We offer a position focusing on the junction point of science and its application in the re/insurance industry. We execute on a business directive to grow Swiss Re's competitive edge in natural perils (re)insurance in close collaboration with underwriters and clients. Hence, we are looking for a new team member with an earthquake engineering or seismological background. Then we are sure you are the addition to our team we are looking for! We are looking forward to welcoming a self-confident, reflected while conclusive personality which can work with clients, business partners and senior colleagues and chips in actively to our overall team spirit! We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, including gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

employer_description: Die Raiffeisenbank Sensetal gehört zu den grössten Raiffeisenbanken schweizweit und beschäftigt aktuell 57 Mitarbeitende, davon 2 Lernende. Interessante, verantwortungsvolle und abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeit Kleines, motiviertes Team, partnerschaftlicher Umgang Moderner Arbeitsplatz, fortschrittliche Anstellungsbedingungen Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten Warum Raiffeisen? Für Fragen zum Bewerbungsprozess: Raiffeisenbank Sensetal Silvia Burri Bernstrasse 15 3175 Flamatt silvia.burri@raiffeisen.ch / www.raiffeisen.ch/sensetal Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Onlinebewerbung Über uns Wir sind eine genossenschaftliche Bank mit über 10'000 Mitarbeitenden. Raiffeisen 80 - 100% Werden Sie Teil unseres Teams! Die Raiffeisenbank Sensetal gehört zu den grössten Raiffeisenbanken schweizweit und beschäftigt aktuell 57 Mitarbeitende, davon 2 Lernende. Wir setzen auf eine partnerschaftliche Beziehung zwischen unseren Mitarbeitenden, die durch Dialog, Fairness und soziale Verantwortung geprägt ist. Als regional stark verwurzelte und innovative Bank haben wir uns in den letzten Jahren konsequent zur Beratungsbank weiterentwickelt. An unseren Standorten haben wir zukunftsweisende Beratungskonzepte umgesetzt und können uns auf die vielfältigen Bedürfnisse unserer Kunden fokussieren. Wir sehen uns als Gastgeber, suchen aktiv die Begegnungen mit Menschen und gehen motiviert und begeistert auf die Anliegen unserer Kunden ein. Für unsere erfolgreiche, moderne Bank suchen wir zur Verstärkung unseres Teams eine selbständige, engagierte sowie dienstleistungsorientierte Führungspersönlichkeit als Leiter Kreditverarbeitung / Credit Officer. Wir freuen uns auf Sie! Thomas Feurer, Leiter Services & Mitglied der Bankleitung Was erwartet Sie? Unsere Anforderungen: Abgeschlossene Bankausbildung sowie betriebs- bzw. Wir machen den Weg frei. Miteinander. Entdecken Sie unsere einzigartige Kultur. Wir leben unternehmerisches Engagement und Fairness. Wir vereinen persönliche Lebensplanung und berufliche Weiterentwicklung.

That’s the number of associates in the Novartis Institutes for BioMedical Research (NIBR). This division is the innovation engine of Novartis, focusing on powerful new technologies that have the potential to help produce therapeutic breakthroughs for patients. With Novartis expanding its horizons in the area of targeted radioligand therapy (RLT), the Oncology department of the Novartis Institutes for Biomedical Research (NIBR) is looking for a Ph.D scientist with a strong background and record of accomplishment in cancer cell biology. Your responsibilities: Define and execute best experimental strategy to deliver interpretable data to test hypotheses, address scientific questions and progress projects Perform lab work (in vitro) to deliver the highest quality of experimental science Guide, supervise and develop scientific associates Contribute to drug discovery and clinical development projects within multidisciplinary teams Develop novel ideas and concepts aimed at identifying optimal ways to use cancer drugs, including RLTs in patients Present concepts and projects in a clear, scientifically sound and data-driven, objective manner in different settings and venues Closely work with multiple teams across expertise groups within Oncology (Translational Clinical Oncology, Drug Discovery, Immuno-oncology, Target Identification and Validation, Bioinformatics, Cellular Assays, Enzymology and Biochemistry, in vivo Pharmacology) and across departments in the global organization Manage lab resources in a flexible manner to adapt to changing priorities Minimum requirements What you’ll bring to the role: Ph.D. with a minimum of 3-4 years postdoc experience Strong cancer biology background and track record of scientific accomplishment at high standards, Background in RLT and DDR is highly desirable Excellent communication and presentation skills in English, Highly collaborative and self-motivated team player with pro-active interactive attitude across a large and diverse environment Used to successfully perform and accomplish within a high productivity, high quality, competitive environment Ability to mentor lab members Desirable requirements: Knowledge and practical experience in immuno-oncology considered advantageous State-of-the-art experimental expertise in molecular and cellular biology and proficiency in data analysis (bioinformatics skills considered advantageous) Why consider Novartis? 769 million lives were touched by Novartis medicines in 2020, and while we are proud of this, we know there is so much more we could do to help improve and extend people’s lives. Imagine what you could do at Novartis! Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion: Novartis embraces diversity, equal opportunity and inclusion. The Position About the program This internship position is part of Roche's Global Internship Program in Innovation & Sustainability (#IP2TIS) . At Roche, we nurture a culture of innovation and sustainability, empowering brilliant minds like yours to build lasting impact. In this program you collaborate with industry experts on trailblazing projects, and contribute to Roche's pursuit of a sustainable future. Together, we'll work towards reducing water consumption in the fill level calibration process, leaving a positive mark on the environment and supporting Roche's commitment to sustainability. A self-starter who stays up-to-date on the latest advancements in the field and is committed to supporting Roche's sustainability goals. Application deadline: 23.04.2023 Start of the internship: 01.07.2023 Duration: at least 3 months, with a possibility of extension Location: Basel Workload: 100% Who we are At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Who we are At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Basel is the headquarters of the Roche Group and one of its most important centres of pharmaceutical research. Over 10,700 employees from over 100 countries come together at our Basel/Kaiseraugst site, which is one of Roche`s largest sites. We believe in the power of diversity and inclusion, and strive to identify and create opportunities that enable all people to bring their unique selves to Roche. Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our dynamic #IP2TIS program, tailored for outstanding Bachelor, Master's, and MBA students, runs for 2-3 months during summer 2023. Conduct a thorough feasibility check of the concept, analyzing all relevant data and information to determine whether the solution is viable and practical. Who you are You're currently enrolled as a Bachelor's or master's student or recently completed your university studies (graduation not longer than 12-month ago) with a background in engineering especially electrical engineering, automation etc. A self-starter who stays up-to-date on the latest advancements in the field and is committed to supporting Roche's sustainability goals. Fluent in German, with strong written and spoken English skills, able to effectively communicate with a diverse range of stakeholders both locally and internationally. A team player who builds strong relationships, collaborates well with others, and has strong interpersonal skills to achieve shared goals. Application deadline: 23.04.2023 Start of the internship: 01.07.2023 Duration: at least 3 months, with a possibility of extension Location: Basel Workload: 100% Who we are At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Together, we can make a real difference! CH - Visp Lonza ist heute ein weltweit führendes Unternehmen im Bereich Life Sciences mit mehr als 100 Produktionsstandorten und Niederlassungen sowie rund 15‘000 Vollzeitmitarbeitenden weltweit. Ihr Anforderungsprofil: Sie haben Ihren erlernten Beruf mit einem Eidgenössischen Fachzeugnis (EFZ) abgeschlossen Die Ausbildung als CPT/ZO ist von Vorteil Als Operator konnten Sie über mehrere Jahre Erfahrung sammeln Sie bringen IT-Kenntnisse mit (Microsoft Office vorausgesetzt, Delta-V von Vorteil) Genauigkeit, hohes Sicherheitsbewusstsein, körperliche Belastbarkeit, Flexibilität und Teamfähigkeit zeichnen Sie neben Ihrem Fachwissen ebenso aus Sie sprechen und schreiben fliessend Deutsch Lonza’s Produkte und Services wirken sich täglich positiv auf Millionen von Menschen aus. Bei Lonza wird Respekt grossgeschrieben und wir schützen sowohl unsere Mitarbeiter als auch unsere Umwelt. Menschen werden Teil der Lonza, um herausfordernde und komplexe Problemstellungen durch kreative und innovative Ansätze im Bereich Life Sciences zu lösen. Wir sind in der Wissenschaft tätig, jedoch gibt es keine Zauberformel dafür, wie wir die Arbeit angehen. Unsere wichtigste wissenschaftliche Lösung sind talentierte Mitarbeitende, die zusammenarbeiten und Ideen entwickeln, die anderen Unternehmen helfen, Menschen zu helfen. Im Gegenzug steuern unsere Mitarbeitenden ihre Karriere selbstständig. Denn ihre Ideen, ob gross und klein, verbessern die Welt. Und das ist die Art von Arbeit, an der wir Teil haben möchten. Wir sind kürzlich als der globale Herstellungspartner für die Produktion der Moderna Impfung gegen den Coronavirus bestätigt worden. Als Partner ermöglichen wir eine Verzehnfachung der Produktionskapazität. Wir sind in der glücklichen Lage, in Zeiten grosser Unsicherheit für viele Unternehmen, die Möglichkeit nachhaltigen Wachstums zu haben. Am Standort Visp wird ein/e erfahrene und belastbare Person als Operator/in gesucht für unseren Produktionsbetrieb "Launch Plant". Ihre Aufgaben: Sie führen Ihre Arbeit sicher und selbstständig aus unter Einhaltung der Sicherheitsvorschriften (SiVo), der Arbeitsanweisungen und der Betriebsordnung Für die Sauberkeit und Ordnung an Ihrem Arbeitsplatz sind Sie mitverantwortlich. Die selbstständige Ausführung und Protokollierung von Arbeitsabläufen und Rundgängen in der Produktionsanlage gemäss den Vorgabedokumenten gehört zu den Kernaufgaben. Sie bringen Ihr gesammeltes Fachwissen in die Praxis ein. Durch Ihre Polyvalenz sind Sie die flexibel für Spezialaufträge / Einsätze. Ihre aktive Kommunikation mit den anderen Schichtteammitgliedern und dem Schichtteamleiter stellt die gegenseitige Information sicher. An zugeteilten Schulungen und Kursen nehmen Sie aktiv teil und erweitern selbstständig Ihre Anlagekenntnisse.

Your team designs and builds the hardware, software and networking technologies that power all of Google's services. Your work has the potential to shape the machinery that goes into our cutting-edge data centers affecting millions of Google users. In this role, you will design, optimize, and validate the antenna solutions across different wireless technologies (e.g., Cellular, Global Navigation Satellite System (GNSS), WiFi/Bluetooth, Ultra-Wideband (UWB)) and collaborate closely with talented cross-functional teams in designing and manufacturing industry leading hardware products that users truly enjoy.Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Devices & Services team combines the best of Google AI, Software, and Hardware to create radically helpful experiences for users. Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent practical experience. 3 years of experience designing antennas for consumer electronics. Experience using RF equipment (e.g., spectrum analyzers, network analyzers, and communication test boxes). Preferred qualifications: Master's degree in Electrical Engineering specializing in Antenna, RF, or Electromagnetics. Familiarity with regulatory requirements (FCC, IC, CE, etc.) Familiarity with wireless industry standards and specifications (e.g., 3GPP, CTIA, PTCRB, WiFi alliance, etc.). As an Antenna Design Engineer, you will be a part of our Hardware Design team building amazing Pixel products. In this role, you will design, optimize, and validate the antenna solutions across different wireless technologies (e.g., Cellular, Global Navigation Satellite System (GNSS), WiFi/Bluetooth, Ultra-Wideband (UWB)) and collaborate closely with talented cross-functional teams in designing and manufacturing industry leading hardware products that users truly enjoy.Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Be responsible for antenna system development and validation while collaborating with cross-functional teams during product development and execution. Be responsible for any antenna related certification and compliance issues debug and corrective actions.

In the end the purpose is to find the smartest solutions, people and companies to complement IKEA to provide a better life for the many. Key responsibilities (title) Your responsibilities    Key responsibilities (text) You will:    Perform initial screening of opportunities from a detailed technical perspective, especially highlighting congruence and differences with industry standards   Perform from a detailed technical perspective an initial assessment of effort and complexity in relation to IKEA technical landscape   Lead technical due diligence in coordination and collaboration with e.g. IKEA product and technology teams   Structure and maintain relevant data on all investment cases addressed   Follow and analyze the development of the industry from a detailed and hands on technical perspective   Translate technology advancements into potential scouting tasks and acquisition objects   Support industry mapping and analysis of relevant acquisition targets   Support preparation of presentations which outline the strategic rationale for an investment or acquisition from a detailed technical perspective   Support, from a technology perspective, the integration process of acquired companies   Lead, coach and develop members of the technology investments function by ensuring assigned teams understand the overall direction, vision, delivery process and responsibilities for any given initiative. Together we work to find new digital solutions for every business need to help make IKEA a great and efficient place to work. This is IKEA. Who you are    Candidate profile (text) - Default language Someone who loves to connect to innovative companies, meet with the world smartest people and is great at assessing their technologies. We meet a lot of tech driven players and startups, either for acquisition of commercial partnership. In both cases we are looking for someone who likes to learn from these companies and also likes to challenge and get the real current state of the presented technologies in a very short time frame. To develop the business and deliver results, we are looking for a Digital Due Diligence Manager with strong experience from both a technical- and reporting perspective to join our Ecosystems & Partnerships team. Together we work to find new digital solutions for every business need to help make IKEA a great and efficient place to work. Feel free to reach out to our recruiter Kate Nash via kate.nash@ingka.com We are looking forward to receiving your application. At the heart of our offer are our beautiful home-furnishing products and solutions, made with care for our planet, reaching millions of customers. At the heart of our business, are our wonderful co-workers representing diversity in all dimensions and passionate for life at home.

Kinderbetreuung zu Hause (Im Stundenlohn nach Auftrag) Die Dienstleistung Kinderbetreuung zu Hause (KBH) bietet in schwierigen Situationen den Eltern vorübergehend Entlastung an Als Betreuerin der Kinder unterstützen Sie auf Abruf bei Notsituatio- nen Familien zu Hause Ihre Einsätze sind stunden- oder tageweise Sie bieten Entlastung bei Erkrankung der Kinder oder zur Unterstützung der Eltern Ihre Aufgaben Sie betreuen stunden- oder tageweise Kinder in deren Zuhause Die Betreuung gestalten Sie entsprechend den Vereinbarungen mit den Erziehungsberechtigten Sie beschäftigen die Kinder dem Alter entsprechend und bereiten Mahlzeiten zu Sie verrichten Körperpflege und Haushaltarbeiten, die für die Betreuung der Kinder unmittelbar not- wendig sind Ihr Profil Sie bringen eine Ausbildung und Erfahrung im Bereich Erziehung, Betreuung und Pflege von Kindern mit Sie haben Interesse und Freude im Umgang mit gesunden und kranken Kindern Sie sind bereit sehr unregelmässig nach Auftrag zu arbeiten Sie sind belastbar und können mit schwierigen Betreuungssituationen umgehen Sie verfügen über ein ausgeprägtes Einfühlungsvermögen, sind selbständig, zuverlässig, flexibel und verschwiegen This portfolio combines our functional and technical capabilities to help clients transform, modernize, and run their existing technology platforms. Core Industry Solutions (CIS) is focused on industry vertical, sector specific solutions that drive operational change and automate the core of the business Operations Transformation (OT) is focused on creating a flexible, innovative business model for clients supported by a strong operations foundation. CBO serves clients across Life Sciences and Health Care, Government & Public Services and Financial Services among other industries. You will work with functional and technical teams on the project located across shores. The team CBO practitioners work on design, delivery and support of a variety of solutions that help our clients meet business objectives. These solutions range from large scale ground-up custom developed applications, to cloud based development and integration services as well as customizing industry sector focused packages. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people, and our communities. Dans ce cas, nous nous réjouissons de recevoir votre candidature en ligne complète. ­ En tant que responsable du CC Marché, vous êtes responsable de la procédure de commande des transports publics et de la garantie des revenus des activités principales et complémentaires Vous dirigez le CC Marché avec une dizaine de collaborateurs directement subordonnés Enfin, vous réunissez les deux unités Vente et Marketing en une nouvelle équipe, êtes responsable du portefeuille de produits, de la planification des ventes et de la réalisation des chiffres d'affaires prévus. Dans votre cœur de métier, vous assurez des offres planifiables, des justificatifs corrects des prestations et une transparence totale vis-à-vis des commanditaires En étroite collaboration avec les Centres de compétences Planification, Tarifs et distribution, Services aux voyageurs et avec les prestations sectorielles, vous assurez une amélioration continue dans les processus Vous soutenez l'innovation dans le développement des offres de service public en fonction des besoins Vous êtes une personne dotée d'une réflexion analytique et logique qui s'y retrouve facilement dans un environnement réglementaire complexe.

Pour notre secteur Mouvements, nous recherchons un Responsable de groupe (H/F) dont la mission principale sera la gestion en binôme, d’une équipe qui assurera l'animation de la performance et du référentiel au sein du secteur. Responsabilités Missions de la performance industrielle : Proposer, animer et challenger l’activité au travers d’indicateurs de pilotage Participer à l’élaboration budgétaire du secteur Animer des chantiers OPEX (définition du besoin, mise en place, rendre robuste, former et rendre autonome Mener des projets spécifiques Soutenir la mise à disposition d’outils de maitrise de la performance Participer aux projets d’industrialisation et d’amélioration continue Assurer la gouvernance du parc industriel et des données Missions du responsable de groupe : Encadrer et développer une équipe pluridisciplinaire Assurer la gestion administrative et opérationnelle de l'équipe (recrutement, planification, évaluation, ...) Déployer la stratégie et la culture de management définies au sein du secteur Etre ambassadeur de la cohésion d’équipe et actif dans l'animation de la transversalité Etre le relais OPEX pour le secteur Profil Titulaire d’un diplôme d’ingénieur HES ou titre jugé équivalent Expérience dans le Lean Management Etre prêt à développer ses compétences de manager coach Compétences reconnues en gestion, organisation et planification des tâches Autonome et flexible avec un sens élevé des responsabilités Vision globale : capacité d’analyse et de synthèse avérée Leadership : compétences relationnelles et excellent communicateur Connaissance approfondie de SAP et des outils MS Office Conclusion Nous vous offrons un environnement stimulant, d'excellentes conditions de travail et des prestations sociales de premier ordre.
